The metro line 4, being almost on your doorstep made commuting so easy. We took the train everywhere, even with loads of luggage to the airport. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. My one request was to have adjoining rooms, which unfortunately they did not have, but they ensured that we had rooms directly next to each other, which I appreciated so much.
The noisy AC unit and the incredibly small bathroom, and the shower missing a door. Nore however if this was all that was available for me to have a room close to my kids rooms...I am ok with that as being close to them was my number 1 priority.

Great location. Wonderful, hospitable staff. Lovely hotel
Nothing

Very close to train station. Clean rooms and very friendly staff. Excellent breakfast.
A bit far from city

Reception staff are excellent and very helpful. The breakfast was also excellent.
The bath blocked and the toilet stopped flushing at one point. This was however sorted very quickly by reception. The room itself needed a good clean. The phone and side tables were very dusty and looked as though they hadn‚Äôt been cleaned for months.

Good breakfast.
Nothing really

Nice size room, very quiet, the staffs are great.
The complimentary water and drinks are pleasant surprises.
Close to the tram station
AC had loud noise and unpleasant smell one evening

The staff were friendly and very helpful.
Being woken up at 1.30am for a fire alarm evacuation -false alarm thankfully but wasn‚Äôt great to have to take two small children to the street in the middle of the night. Apparently a guest had a very hot bath and the steam caused the alarm to go off. Good to have a fire alarm that works so well so not really the hotels fault but I can‚Äôt see the ventilation in the bathroom stopping this occurring. We still had a good time but we‚Äôre just all very tired the next day! Think a gesture of a free breakfast the next day would have been a nice touch!

It was very clean and staff were extremely helpful
The location is a bit gat from major attractions

The hotel was very well located. Right across the train and metro, market and bakery. Despite facing the street with its beautiful balconies, it was fairly quiet at night. The staff, especially Doudou, were friendly and accommodating. The hotel was also doing an extra effort to be more green. Nothing bad to say about it but do not expect the rooms to be big, it's uncommon for Paris.
Nothing.

The location was very close to the metro and a tram line. Many tourist sites were within 30 minutes of the hotel.
The property seemed more like a 3 star. They didn‚Äôt have any disposable razors and the facilities needed repainting as well as some repairs to the walls. There was visible paint chipping in the balcony and near the air conditioner. The neighborhood had a few unhoused individuals as well but they leave you alone.

Breakfast very good - quality ingredients & plenty of choice. Location very good for us
Room very hot & badly designed so ended up being cramped too much furniture only one double wardrobe needed - not two

The staff was excellent. Especially Maureen and Tatiana. The room was very quiet even though it faced the street, and also close to the metro.
The bed was a little hard for me. Also, I would like to see more color in the room as well as the
lobby.

Room facilities were excellent, with loads of space, free drinks in the fridge, and a very comfortable bed. Service was also good with the bed made, drinks topped up. Transport around Paris was simple from the RER, 15 minutes walk away.
The only real negative was the lack of any instructions on use the Nespresso machine, which meant that I was unable to have any coffee.

the location is good and lots of public transport nearby, the building is pretty accessible and the space that was available as used as best they could
Bed too short, airco didn't work but also didn't look like it had been cleaned for over a year (mold on the inside), window next to kitchen exhaust, so causes the air to smell like a frying pan.

Very nice stay.
N/A

Breakfast and staff was great
Bathroom and bed would have been cleaner

The breakfest is superb. The food is exceeding my expectations. And the staff are friendly. Thanks to Semia.
The receipt was wrong for me.

Hotel is in good location, one minute walk from metro station. We had a superior room which was quite spacious compared to other hotels available in Paris.
Keep in mind that there is an additional regional tax to be paid in the hotel - 5 euros per night per person (there is no information about this tax on Booking, we expected to pay city tax 25 euros, with this regional tax the bill was 65 euros..). 
No one from the staff cleaned dirty dishes from the tables during breakfast.

The staff were very friendly.
The shower had no door or screen so the bathroom was covered in water after taking a shower. There were dirty marks on the surface around the coffee machine and not much space for a family when the pull out bed was in the place.

All staff is pleasant, particularly Maureen, the receptionist was very helpful, and the housekeeping lady. The hotel location is only 1 minute walks from Porte d'Olean, and many good restaurants around and as well pastries shops in the opposite of the hotel. The breakfast is decent with reasonable choices.
The WiFi was really poor, and there was some smell from the toilet. But, it's ok as the window can be opened. The sound proof was bad, I can hear the guest talking in the next room.

Location, bed, the little note that the staff left for.me was awesome
I only write this as i know the hotel would want the feedback. I called prior to arriving and asked for a room over the street. The chap i spoke to said no problem. I had a view of the bins üò©. The roome was awesome though.

Felt like a happy team work there which made for a nice warm environment

Key requirements met
Not too big

Breakfast and personal very good
Room size very small

Very modern, excellent breakfast, very clean!

The location

Not my first time in this hotel and I‚Äôll be staying again. Spacious rooms, the staff is nice and the breakfast is awesome. Breakfast lady Samia is wonderful, caring, smiling, always keeping tables clean and getting everyone more food. Really great start of the day.
I did like the room with the city view much better than the one that has courtyard view.

Everything was wonderful excluding breakfast
Breakfast

Had the most pleasant stay at this hotel and can‚Äôt find any faults. Upon checking in, the lady at reception was welcoming and friendly. Check in took less than 5 minutes. My room was exactly as advertised- perfect for solo travel and even for two people. Bed and pillows are very comfortable too. I had a room on the second floor that overlooked the main road, with a little balcony. The room is still nice and quiet. The breakfast was delicious with a nice variety. Staff are incredibly friendly (including the gentleman at reception) and helpful and go out of their way to make sure you have a pleasant stay. The hotel kept my luggage for me on the day of departure as I had a late flight. Hotel is very nicely located with the M4 train station just a short 50m walk away. I will definitely be returning

Breakfast choice excelent
Bathroom was very small

Renovated, modern. Clean

The hotel is amazing, from the design, to the staff. I loved my stay

The hotel was really clean and the staff was friendly. additionally the size of the room compare to the other parisian hotel was really good

I like the fact that they have express breakfast, this is sufficient for us. 
The metro is really near to the hotel, and bus station is also one street away only ( very short walk ).
Staff were friendly. Rooms were very clean, they did come for room service daily, very appreciate that. 
Definitely will book again if ever going back to Paris.
The bathtub was clogged :( Water couldn't flow but I did not tell the receptionist, so can't blame them if they don't know about it. 
Water wasn't refilled daily for us - not a big deal, we can always refill it via tap water.

The hotel is very handily situated near to Pernety metro station. The decor is good, the staff were really helpful and friendly. The breakfast was mostly good, the bed was comfortable. There is a good working space downstairs, which was handy, as our room was pretty well useless for anything other than sleeping.
Our room was, even by Paris standards, very small, so all there was room for was the bed and a small desk. There were a few coat hangers, on a chain descending from the roof, and a bit of space under the sink, but no wardrobe, drawers or even shelf for storing clothes. The table was taken up with a kettle (good), and a large lamp, so there was hardly any room on it. There was nice shower gel and shampoo, but the body lotion containers were not replaced, there was no shower cap or anything else like that, and only really room for hanging one towel. Breakfast was good, but there were very few tables, and sometimes not much food (it got replaced eventually, but sometimes it took a while). For the price we paid, the experience was really not worth the money. It's a shame, because it is potentially a good hotel, but it's not a place we will be going back to. If you are only there for a couple of nights, it's probably OK, especially if you just need somewhere to sleep (it was very quiet), but it's definitely not a place for a work trip.

Friendly staff, good location, nice shower
Room was very small

Very clean and modern decoration
Lack of a closet and drawers for the clothes

Very comfortable hotel with many cafes and restaurants nearby and an easy walk to the train station. Our room was quiet and comfortable, and the bathroom clean and modern. Breakfast was abundant and very good. We especially loved Juliette, who greeted us so nicely and took good care of us!

Had the Superior double on top floor 6. Comfortable, quiet and tidy.
It‚Äôs an old house, a bit worn. Feels like the small hotel that it is - for good and bad. Four stars?

Hotel was beautifully furnished and the room was small but comfortable. We had a late check in but staff were on site and made it a speedy process. Location is also amazing, with a 2 minute walk to the metro so getting into central Paris was very easy.
N/A

Nice and quiet neighbourhood, only a few step to the next Metro Station (Pernety). Nicely decorated rooms, very friendly staff. My third or forth stay at the Bob Hotel.

Calm and nice neighbourhood, only a few steps to the metro. Nicely decorated rooms, separate toilet.
Helpful and friendly service :)

Lovely hotel, great air conditioning, good breakfast, excellent location very close to metro.
No press or wardrobe for clothes

Great location; very clean and a lovely bed. Small room but well designed. Would definitely go back. 2 minutes from the Metro station and 20 minutes walk from Monparnasse Station.
The aircon doesnt work too well and has a very annoying flashing green light which you eitheer have to cover up (somehow) or turn it off which is not ideal in August

The staff are simply wonderful! Nice central outdoor courtyard. Great AC! Kept us nice and cool. Breakfast was good, not great. We like to walk, it was about a 40 minute walk to Beach Volleyball at the Eiffel Tower!
Room was very small. Windows open onto courtyard so it was loud in the morning. We were there for the Olympics, so it was quite expensive.

Location was amazing- very near station 
Clean
Luggage storage if needed
Only downside was no bar to relax in but this was made clear

Lovely little place , quirky , convenient, clean,
Rooms lovely

We stayed at Bob hotel for one night (twice, over the course of our trip). We needed somewhere central to Montparnasse, good value and with 24 hour reception - Bob was all these and more. It was very comfortable, seemed recently refurbished with modern decor, had welcoming staff and - unlike an increasing number of hotels - it had tea/coffee in the room.
If you have a lot of luggage, the rooms are quite small to store them or hang up clothes but this isn‚Äôt unusual for city centre hotels (especially at such great value)

The hotel‚Äôs chic, modern design combined with its welcoming and cozy atmosphere made for a perfect retreat in the heart of the city.

The rooms are tastefully decorated, clean and comfortable.
Nothing.

Very cute boutique hotel in great location. Complimentary croissants and great working space. Optional sauna for use too!
Advertisement said complimentary robes and slippers and those weren‚Äôt provided. Staff wasn‚Äôt even aware of that offer.

Location was very good, close to metro station. Easy to get anywhere, but very quiet neighborhood.
Breakfast was very basic I wouldn‚Äôt recommend to pay extra. I would rather go to nearby boulanegrie. 
I‚Äôve booked standard double room but bed was a twin joined so not very comfortable for a couple

Tiny room and very expensive

Conveniently positioned, trendy decor, well equipped rooms, friendly staff always available to help

Well planned Rooms and Good Staff 
Clean rooms
Nothing

Location is great close to bars,cafes and restaurants. There is also a self service laundromat which is fairly cheap. The hotel room was beautiful and the shower was nice and hot. A quiet area at nice which was great

Helpful staff & the hammam was a nice perk!

Very well designed, functional and small boutique hotel.
Like every other Parisian hotel, quite small rooms, but I didn‚Äôt mind as I traveled solo

quiet, clean, friendly staff, comfort
Interior too dark colors to me

The Staff was super friendly & very helpful. They gave us an amazing welcome & great service during our stay! The hotel is small with a nice and stylish design. The beds were very comfortable & we enjoyed to stay on the 6th floor. We would book it again.
For us personally a balcony would have been nice or windows that you can fully open.

Hotel in a nice residential neighbourhood, only a few steps to the metro (Pernety, Line 13). Close to several interesting spots like the Rue des Thermopyles, Cit√© Bauer, cimeti√®re Montparnasse ... Nicely decorated rooms. Great and very friendly service. Merci beaucoup :)

Our favourite hotel and arrondissement in Paris. We stayed at this hotel twice and will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Paris.

All was good

Reception told me i couldnt get an invoice

The superior room was good, providing more space. Very nice decoration and the bed was very comfy. Nice bathroom as well. Both room and bathroom were well equipped. Nice breakfast too with choices. Staff is very nice.
Unfortunately, I had noisy neighbours on my second night. The breakfast room is a bit small. Saying that, I would still recommend that hotel.

Food was great. The staff were great. The bed was lovely and comfy. The sound proofing was really good. I opened the window at night and realised the window shut was sound proof! Everyone was welcoming
Very little was ‚Äúoff‚Äù. I like a bath‚Ä¶ just my preference. Otherwise all good

Been here several times and for me its the perfect location to discover Paris. Conveniently located metro station at the end of the street.
This time we were offered a rather tiny room (compared to the rooms I stayed in before) in the 2nd building and with a very unpleasant smell in the bathroom - assuming its a broken ventilation issue. I requested a different room and suggested to fix the issue before letting any other guests stay in that room.

Great location.
Towels could of been replaced they had been well used ,also no milk small cartons replaced in the room after I had use them on the first night .Just small things after a good stay .

Lovely to have a bath. Pretty lights in the bathroom. Good to have a kettle. Great to have free filtered water.
Only one suitcase rack. Bedroom was small like most Paris rooms. No double glazing to the street.

Location great and all amenities in the hotel. Very comfy beds
None

Was close enough to center and it had friendly and helpful staff
Was cold in the room , no fridge and no wardrobe

Cosy interior design, welcoming employees at the reception, nice size of the bathroom. 
Cleaning the room every day. Opportunity to get filtered water. 
1 min walking to the metro.
The breakfasts were not super fresh. 
A little bit too far away from the city center.

Modern design, room amenities are nice, close to Metro, room of a decent size, elevator large unlike many hotels in Paris
No fridge in room, cleanliness was subpar, price is high for what is offered or location (area is certainly not the liveliest, restaurant around are average, so are bistros)

The bed was comfy, everything was clean.
The bathroom was really nice, the staff were friendly and the facilities offered were great. I absolutely recommend this hotel. It's also right next to the Metro and in a good location.
Some might say the room was a little small but that wasn't an issue for us

The area and the hotel atmosphere
There was no opportunity to hang the coat in the room. I found a hair in the shower after the previous client‚Ä¶it was a bit windy from the windows.

The decoration is fine.
The room is too small for 2 adult.

Great location and lovely room
The size of the lift was small and awkward to fit 2 people in

Excellent staff, great location and close to metro station and the staff was very attentive and the rooms clean and pretty

I liked the staff most of all. Very curtious, very helpful, and accommodating. Melanie on the reception went out of her way to help me through a mess up in my booking and made everything feel so seemless.
I wish there was a gym or a deal with a gym near by.

Location was perfect, at the heart of La Fayette and reachable via metro easily. You can also walk to the very nice tourist attractions. The room was cozy, spacy and clean. And the staff was friendly and helpful. There was a very nice welcoming in our room: some nicely decorated fruits and a postcard to my name.
The air-conditioning was a bit noisy and the child bed was not as comfortable as ours (there were apertures on both sides of the bed that we needed to put pillows to prevent our kid falling). But not a big deal for short stays.

Location was not bad as it was just a 20 minute walk from Gare du Nord. Room was clean and staff were friendly and helpful.
Would be great if disposable slippers were provided. Price seemed to be double compared to the standard price as I stayed at the property 3 weeks before the Paris 2024 Olympics...other than that, everything was good.

Great location, lovely staff! Quick and efficient service, though we only stayed one night everything went well.

For the reservation on Booking it said no payment with credit card until you are at Hotel...the hotel charged us the amount of hotel room and reseved it..by check in at hotel we paid 90 Euros just for a Deposit. We had a double charge on our debit card after we payed for the hotel room on our last day because the credit card machine did not work the first time but after trying again it worked. After all this headache...I have to say...at the Reception desk and in the book keeping dept. the employees were very helpfull to solve the problem. After many emails and calls from us we received after 1 week all our money back.

For the traveller familiar with Premier Inn, the room was like that but with a kitchenette and not as clean.

I like the hotel's location. The nearest Metro station is within a couple of minutes' walk. In the evening, you can walk to the Trocadero square for a scenic view of the Eiffel Tower at sunset. There are plenty of cafes and shops around where you can have a coffee in the morning or buy groceries after coming from the business meeting (if you don't feel like dining out at the restaurants).

Room was clean. Location is close to Eifel Tower and Arc de Triomphe. Restaurants are also close by.

Bed is very comfortable. WiFi.

Very courteous staff, excellent location as just short walk from trocadero and Eiffel Tower.. property is well maintained and modern with spacious layout. We had a big balcony which was a plus!

we loved the breakfast at this place, they have a good selection of pastries, coffee, juices aside from pancakes, cereals, yogurts, cheeses, bacon, beans sausages and eggs for 15 euros per person for all you can eat. highly recommended.

Not a polished property but clean and reasonably very priced close to lots of amenities. As an apartment hotel it was nice to have a small cooker, dishwasher and microwave. ( I spent five nights at the Hilton Canopy Trocad√©ro and three at Citidines - 3 nights at Citidines costs the same as -=1 night at that Hilton. Theree are lots of great little supermarkets, nails, massage, salons and a cute kosher bakery next door all added to the charm of the neighbourhood. Walking distance to Eiffel Tower. They also have a downstairs terrace and lounge which make for nice places to read the paper. Notable was the very friendly and helpful receptionist -
I cannot remember her name but she had glasses and was exceptional.
The terrace off the bedroom was truly ugly. A few plants and this could be a nice feature. The air-conditioner was noisey and towels and linen were thin but everything was very clean.

The room was clean, very functional. The kitchen has everything you might need to make dinner, there's also a dishwasher which was great! There's a supermarket 1 minute from the hotel, which was great. Prices are amazing in Paris, and Europe in general. Could have been nice to have extra covers in the room, there was exactly 1 cover for each person, and we needed a bit more.

The location is great - it's 10 minutes walk from the Trocadero Square - which has the best view of the Eiffel Tower in all of Paris. You can walk down another 10 minutes to reach the tower itself. From the other side of the hotel, you can walk in the opposite direction about 10-15 minutes, and reach the Champs-Elysee, which is also great to visit. All in all - it's really a nice quiet neighborhood, but yet very central.
The staff at the reception could have been nicer. We arrived parched from the walk to the hotel from the metro (about 7 minutes walk) - and we needed to ask for a few cups to drink water. There was a water cooler there but without cups, which we needed to pour water into something. We received, after getting a few grim faces for even asking, exactly 10 mini paper cups for the whole family (we were 10 people). The staff there is a bit young, like maybe people in their 20s, so I assume they don't care much about genuine customer service. They were very "functional", so we didn't care much.

this Citadines is located close to multiple museums and walking distance to the Eiffel tower. There are 3 metro lines a few blocks away. The rooms are clean and seem to be newly renovated. The staff is very helpful and tried to accommodate needs.

Excellent location, lift, AC as Paris was extremely hot in June, convenience, luggage storage

Located on a quieter and more residential, local area of Paris. So a pleasant change after walking around some of the busier, more touristy parts. Even the cafes and restaurants in this area are more local. A short walk to two metro stations, making it very easily accessible.

Very clean, and big enough for a family of 4. first impressions were fantastic and Vincent greeted us upon arrival and was absolutely magnificent. Overall the staff were pleasant. On our first night there was a fire alarm at the hotel which was due to the staff burning a pizza at 11:30pm. 
I appreciate these things happen and it is no one‚Äôs fault, however I felt the situation was handled badly and staff in the ground floor bar area just stared at us and other guests when we walked into the lobby and stood outside to be told shortly after it was a false alarm. 
Overall there was no guidance on what to do or where to go at the time and for all we knew, our hotel was on fire. Other than this and feeling a bit uneasy about it all, the staff were lovely.

This is my second stay at Pley. The first time I stayed there, I was placed in a small room, which had very small windows looking straight to a wall! Given that prior experience, at check-in, I asked if my room was one of those smaller rooms facing a wall. It turned out that it was. The gentleman then spoke with his manager, who changed my room to a larger, high floor one....all of that I highly appreciated. The room was decent size (esp. in Paris standards), got decent light. Two complimentary bottles of water were replenished every day. The room had a nespresso coffee machine. With 4 capsules that came free. The safe in the room was modern and worked without problems. So was the little fridge. Being very close to our Paris office was also an advantage :)
I asked for an iron, which was promptly delivered to my room. Unfortunately, the base of the iron was dirty and ruined my shirt (maybe I should have checked the iron before putting it on the shirt, but I did not expect its base to be that dirty :/) There were teabags in the room but no kettle or any other way to produce hot water.

Other rooms in our booking were lovely so it seems consistency is an issue and it would be great if they were all to this standard.

This lovely little hotel is a great find. The neighborhood is full of wonderful little restaurants, cafes and shops. We had an excellent and pleasant experience staying at the Plaza Tour Eiffel for our anniversary. We booked a onebedroom room located on the first floor with a street view. Despite the view, the amenities were of high quality. The room was larger than we expected, extremely clean, and very comfortable. 

From the moment we arrived, the staff was there to greet us. Throughout our six-night stay, every staff member we encountered was friendly, helpful and had strong local knowledge. A special mention goes to the night staff member, he was always welcoming and pleasant when we returned to the hotel, from our outings.

The hotel's central location made it convenient to walk to the Eiffel Tower and other landmarks. Additionally, the deli next door is worth several visits. My wife and I loved the cosy breakfast area, where the staff continued to be friendly and helpful.

We highly recommend the Plaza Tour Eiffel to all our friends and family. When we return to Paris, we will definitely stay here again, and thank you for making our anniversary so special it was appreciated.

Lovely cosy hotel, in the Eiffel Tower District. Really helpful and friendly staff team always willing to go the extra mile. Arrived in the evening and William was really welcoming. 

Great view of the top half of the Eiffel Tour and is within walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe and shopping area. 

Short walk to the Metro which is really convenient
Humming of the air conditioning was a bit distracting on the first night, but kind of got used to it.

The staff were exceptional. I don't think I've ever stayed anywhere where the front desk staff were so unbelievably accommodating and helpful. One of the concierge (apologies, can't remember his name) went above and beyond to assist us with last minute tickets to Versailles and the Paris Catacombs. All the staff were generous, delightful, friendly and genuinely sincere. 

The room we booked was tastefully appointed with a large enough modern bathroom. There was a safe, mini fridge and ample room in the wardrobe. The room size itself was on the small side, but that's what we booked, so there were no surprises there. Standard tea/coffee facilities were present in the room as well as a large flat screen tv (which we didn't use because we were in Paris and didn't need to watch tv). 

Location was superb. A 5 min walk to Trocadero Metro station and about 7 min walk to the Eiffel Tower. In fact, we could see the top of the Eiffel tower from our window. The hotel is centrally placed for easy access to all of the Paris hotspots. But it's not on the main drag so you don't get all the loud and crazy noise of the busy Paris streets all day/night. There's a boulangerie right next door, several little cafes, a grocers/mini market, tabac, etc., all within a few minutes walk. 

If I ever return to Paris again, I'd definitely book this hotel again. Truly a little gem.
Breakfast wasn't great if I'm honest. I think it's quite overpriced for what you get. ‚Ç¨7 per person for 1 coffee or tea and 2 small pastries (croisant or pain au chocolat). Considering that at a boulangerie I can get all of that for half that price, it's a bit much. We only used it out of necessity because the boulangeries were closed on Sunday sadly.

The location of the hotel is just amazing. Trocadero and Eiffel tower are just around the corner. Staff was very nice and the room was well equipped, comfy and clean.

full_description:
Le Royal Saint Germain est un h√¥tel de charme situ√© √† Paris, dans le 6√®me arrondissement, quartier historique de la ville, √† 3 minutes √† pied de la station de m√©tro Saint-Placide. Il b√©n√©ficie d'une r√©ception ouverte 24h/24 et d'un service de billetterie. Saint-Germain-des-Pr√©s et Montparnasse sont tous deux √† 500 m√®tres.

Les chambres climatis√©es disposent toutes d'une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite, d'un coffre-fort et d'une t√©l√©vision √† √©cran plat avec des cha√Ænes internationales. Certaines sont √©galement √©quip√©es d'un minibar. Les salles de bains en marbre sont pourvues d'un s√®che-cheveux et d'articles de toilette. 

Un petit-d√©jeuner buffet est servi tous les matins dans le salon commun du Royal Saint Germain. Apr√®s le petit-d√©jeuner, vous pourrez utiliser la borne Internet ou lire les journaux gratuits dans le salon autour d'une boisson chaude pr√©par√©e avec la machine √† caf√© mise √† votre disposition.

L'h√¥tel Royal Saint Germain se trouve √† 10 minutes de marche du jardin du Luxembourg. La gare ferroviaire de Montparnasse est situ√©e √† 1,2 km.

Situ√© au c≈ìur du X√®me arrondissement de Paris, le Mercure Paris Gare du Nord se trouve √† seulement 2 minutes √† pied de la gare du Nord. Vous b√©n√©ficierez d'une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite et d'un acc√®s aux salles de r√©union et √† un nouvel espace de coworking.

Toutes les chambres sont insonoris√©es. Elles disposent de la climatisation, d'un minibar et d'une t√©l√©vision par satellite √† √©cran plat. Leur salle de bains privative comporte un s√®che-cheveux.

Des boissons vous seront servies dans le bar. Tous les matins, vous pourrez d√©guster un petit-d√©jeuner tous les matins dans l'√©l√©gante salle pr√©vue √† cet effet.

Vous s√©journerez √† proximit√© du canal Saint-Martin et de la place de la Bastille. La station de m√©tro Magenta se trouve √† 50 m√®tres de l'h√¥tel, tandis que la gare de l'Est est √† 500 m√®tres. Montmartre et la basilique du Sacr√©-C≈ìur sont √† 1,8 km.

5 minute walk from Gare du Nord. Great spot if you plan to visit all areas of Paris. A trip to the southern parts can take a substantial amount of time. Reserve at least 1 hour for metro travel in that case.

Shops of all sorts and restaurants are plenty, most of them in front and in the side streets of the station.
The hotel is located just outside that busy area with at least 2 supermarkets between them.

Bathroom in the basic room is small, with green perspex doors. OK for max 2 nights.
Had a different room the next day which was a lot bigger, also had a bigger bathroom with a glass door in blue design and a better layout. Much better and a wiser choice for a longer stay (+2 days).
Beds are still changed on a daily basis and used towels replaced. 
Breakfast is of the "American" style. 

Room on street-side overlooks the platforms from Gare de L'est so it is very close to both. 
As a result their station announcements can be heard as is the odd rumbling train. 
A closed balcony door eliminates those sounds quite well.

Know that a city tax (13/night) needs to be paid upon arrival. 
It is not included in the price of the booking.

Excellent location to Gard Du Nord station especially if catching the Eurostar.

It's also very close to train connections and metros (but also, the kind of sketchy folks that linger around train stations and metros). Nothing they can do about that though.
The room safe was quite odd - different than any other, and I succeeded in locking my passports inside. The maintenance staff also are off on the weekends! Fortunately the staff there were able to unlock the safe - but those safe's should be replaced. 

Also, the neighborhood - not great, but increasingly sketchy as you move towards the station. For couples or families, consider farther away from any station (mea culpa on that one).

full_description:
Le Best Western Plus La Demeure est am√©nag√© dans un b√¢timent haussmannien typique situ√© √† quelques pas de la vibrante rue Mouffetard ainsi qu‚Äô√† 450 m√®tres du Jardin des plantes et du mus√©e d‚Äôhistoire naturelle. Vous b√©n√©ficierez d‚Äôune connexion Wi-Fi gratuite. L‚Äô√©tablissement poss√®de une salle de sport et centre de bien-√™tre avec une douche multi-sensorielle. Des massages sont dispens√©s moyennant des frais suppl√©mentaires.

Occupant un b√¢timent construit en 1903, les chambres et les suites sont insonoris√©es et climatis√©es. Elles comprennent une t√©l√©vision √† √©cran plat et une bouilloire √©lectrique. Leur salle de bains privative est pourvue d‚Äôun s√®che-cheveux et d‚Äôarticles de toilette gratuits. Une machine √† caf√© Nespresso est disponible dans toutes les chambres et une bouteille d‚Äôeau est fournie √† l‚Äôarriv√©e.

Le Best Western Plus La Demeure sert un petit-d√©jeuner buffet tous les matins. Un petit-d√©jeuner express pourra √©galement √™tre servi √† un tarif r√©duit.

D√©cor√© dans des tons chaleureux, avec un mobilier en bois fonc√© et des repr√©sentations de Paris accroch√©es aux murs, le salon du rez-de-chauss√©e vous accueille pour prendre un verre.

The staff at Tribe Paris Batignolles are very friendly and attentive. The room was very spacious and modern. The bed was large and comfortable. When compared to other Paris hotels, this room felt so luxurious!

Upon arrival at Tribe, I thought it looked like it was suitable for students rather than a family (particularly for my Mum who is in her 80s) as it has quite a modern vibe. However, it was a really good little hotel. The rooms were very quiet and comfortable and very clean. The bed and in particular the pillows (which always makes a big difference) were lovely. The shower was very modern and powerful. It had a nice garden area, which we didn't use, but this added very much to the ambience of the hotel.
We travelled a lot by taxi due to the fact that my Mum finds mobility hard. This presented a problem for us as the traffic was particularly heavy when travelling from the hotel to the main tourist sights, so allow more time if you travel this way. However if we had of been alone, we would have used the metro all the time as it is just around the corner from the hotel and would have taken a fraction of the time. Once you found your bearings, there were lots of good restaurants and bars around Tribe, particularly in the streets behind the hotel, so well worth a walk about. All of the staff were really friendly and helpful - we couldn't fault them. We had a lovely, comfortable stay and were really pleased with the hotel. Would definitely recommend it.
The room was an adequate size - ideal for a short stay. However, I always feel that small changes would make just that extra difference. A cupboard by the bed with drawers instead of a table to give extra storage. A long mirror on the wall, instead of just by the windows and definitely more hanging space - because not all guests travel light. Keep the foyer modern - the rooms can afford to be a bit less minimalistic.
The black out blind was very good, but my Mum's room also had two small white blinds which were nice for getting up first thing, particularly as our room faced apartments/flats and it's nice to have some light but still have privacy.
The breakfast needed improving. Good to have things covered over for freshness and more variety - we ended up going elsewhere for breakfast even though we'd paid to have it at the hotel.
Where possible and definitely where requested you should try and put your guests together, we were only 3 separate floors.

We had a lovely stay at Tribe. The Batignolles area has lots of nice restaurants, cafes & shops, and hotel is close to two metro stations so very accessible to the rest of Paris. lovely park across the road also! would stay again. nice clean modern rooms.
A small fridge in the room would have been handy.

When I booked the hotel, I asked if we could get a room with a bath. This because I was traveling with my mom and I wanted to surprise her, so I was pleased to see a bath in the bathroom! It made my mom very happy.
What we liked as well was that they cleaned the room every day, even though we didn't hang the sign on the door. They made the bed, refilled the coffee and tea and gave us clean towels. Also all the staff spoke English very well and helped us whenever we had a question.
We didn't book breakfast with our reservation but on the very last day we decided to have breakfast at the hotel. We had two options: breakfast buffet or express breakfast, which included coffee or tea, jus d'orange, half a baguette, a croissant and butter and jam.
We chose the latter one, as we're not the biggest breakfast-eaters, and it was amazing. We loved this option!
The socket didn't work in the bathroom, so we had to dry our hair in the "hall", because that was the only place with a socket and a big enough mirror.

Quaint hotel in a fantastic location. Very close to the Opera Metro station and bus stops. It is also close to the stop for the hop-on, hop-off tourist busses. Very comfortable rooms, small but friendly bar area, and superbly located for many bistros and brasseries.
Breakfast at the hotel isn't terribly exciting. Not bad, but not very good either!

Great location, fantastic interiors, very nice team, the receptionists were very careful, I‚Äôve got a room with a balcony. Many thanks for this! The room was super comfortable!

Great location, friendly stuff

Location is great. Walking distance to Opera metro station. You could also walk easily to some main attractions. Close to shopping. Hotel is on a quiet side street. Room is quiet and a bit snug but cozy. Feels safe in the neighborhood. Staff is polite and helpful.
If you have to spend the day mainly in your rooms, you'd feel a bit caged. Room, a bit on the small side (maybe due to my budget, I landed the smallest room). But I didn't spend much time in the room. So it was OK for me.

Location great, staff pleasant and very helpful getting tickets and information. Bedding great breakfast delicious.

Location right beside PLace de L'Opera and a five minute walk from the Roissybus. All the grands magasins are five to fifteen minutes walk, depending on which you like. Good breakfast for ‚Ç¨17. All staff speak fluent Englishand are happy, at your choice, to work through English or French.
AS is common in Paris, the rooms are small but are well laid out. As an environmental meassure, they havev stopped leaving water in rooms although a bottle can be filled in a fountain at recepption.

Breakfast onsite (including express breakfast when rushing somewhere), rooms were beautiful, bed was big and super comfortable. It had a charming atmosphere in a charming location, near the Opera. Everyone spoke enough English. Reserving a cab to the airport at the front desk was such a convenience.
The bathroom was lovely but best for one person at a time. There was only one sink, although you could stand side-by-side.

Location is perfect, quiet, close to restaurants. Room was good size, bathroom up to date. Staff amazingly helpful!!!

The pillow is too hard and small , if duck-down pillow will be better.

Location was perfect for getting around and close to the metro, room was comfy & breakfast was good. The staff was extremely friendly and so gracious. Sandra saved our lives by getting us the last room available as our reservation at a different hotel where we had a confirmation number, told us they didn't have it and the rude girl at the desk had me in tears. Sandra and the entire staff were so kind. Merci to all
More bathroom amenities would be nice.

What a great stay! The hotels staff very polite, nice and helpful. Was responding very fast to any requests of mine. I appreciate it a lot - you're just amazing!

Process of check in was very fast. 

Room itself was like on the advertised pictures. Comfy beds, pretty spacious bathroom. Cleaning ladies responsible for preparing rooms, did amazing job - cleaning was spotless. Room equipped with flat TV and many TV channels to select in various languages. Room has big windows which was giving a lot of light into the room. However if you like to sleep in complete darkness, room have very thick and well light-isolating curtains. 

Despite of hotel location not far from the Av. de l'Opera (and Opera Garnier) which tend to have pretty serious traffic in the daytime, it was pretty quiet in the room. Street in front of the hotel is very calm and there is almost no traffic.

Hotel have great location for the simple walk to Louvre or Opera Garnier and Galerie Lafayette. Also there is couple of metro lines and RER line not far from hotel, which gives great opportunity to reach all parts of Paris without any serious efforts.

The staff, particularly Isabelle, were welcoming and helpful. They always had a smile and friendly greeting for us. 

The hotel was clean and well appointed. Our room was nicely decorated and had all the amenities we had expected. The warming towel rack was appreciated as it helped us dry some damp clothes after an unexpected downpour. 

The location of the hotel was great! We walked to the Louvre Museum and other sites. The Hop On-Hop Off bus stop is within minutes. We enjoyed shopping and eating in the Opera neighbourhood.

Arranged early breakfast and taxi for the airport. Good location/ felt safe.

Hotel is closed to many museums and city centre ,which is a good place for tourists.Amazing stuff,they are so nice and welcoming to all visitors.Definitely recommend it!!

Everything. We had stayed here probably 6-8 times over the years and always look here first when we come to paris. Excellent and always friendly and helpful front desk. They can‚Äôt be beat. Fernando is wonderful, helpful and friendly, taking our luggage to our room and generally making sure that we
Have all we need. Location of the hotel also cannot be beat. Minutes from the opera, the large department stores, vendome square with the ritz hotel and rue st honore with all the luxury shopping one can handle. A stroll to the louvre and crossing the seine to the left bank and everything it offers. Marais 20 minute walk. We go everywhere walking to st Germain on the left to marais on our side. The hotel staff arranges for your return to the airport too. Room normal size for paris. Our bathroom was redone nicely. Towels really absorvant and thick and new. Queen bed very comfortable and we could open our windows because of the fifth floor the heat tends to be too hot for me.
Nothing was disliked

The room was very nice and clean!

Excellent location, very polite and helpful staff, tasteful breakfast with high quality products. Would come back againüòä!

Location was perfect! Right in the heart of Paris with very easy access to metro station and other transportation. Endless selection of food choices and activities. We are already planning a return to this hotel, if not for this general area. Hotel itself is nice with amazing staff and very accomodating, friendly folks. I would highly recommend this place for people wanting to visit Paris because of the staff and the hotel location.
None. This place is a great place to stay in Paris

Gorgeous room with a balcony, very Parisian which I loved! Great location with plenty of choice for restaurants within walking distance. Friendly staff and welcoming of dogs (at a very reasonable additional cost)
Honestly nothing, we would stay here again.

Quiet and in great location. Staff very helpful. Rooms very comfortable and clean
No problems other than one lift working. However, this did not cause any problems

On my return trip, the hotel arranged a taxi to De Gaulle Airport for the fair price of 65¬£, but the driver wanted 80¬£. I paid, and after returning home, I contacted the hotel. Ms. Alina said that this was very wrong and gave me back 15¬£. Thank you very much for your kind and responsible response even though you were busy. The hotel has a good location, clean rooms and a comfortable lobby, but the kindness and trustworthiness of the staff is the best.

Location was great, staff was really accomodating for early arrival. We are very grateful for this! Close to everything near the vibrant boulevard de l'Opera in the Opera district.
It was a nice comfy room that met the expectations, there is not much to dislike.

Check in was very easy as was communicating with the property prior to arrival. The staff are very friendly and service was good.
There wasn't a permanent waiter in the bar and sometime you had to wait a few minutes to be served. Not a massive issue as the bar was very quiet so made sense not to have someone in there permanently.

The check-in process was smooth. The location is excellent, close to important attractions and quiet considering the proximity of a noisy Opera avenue. Breakfast is fine but could be improved. The offering is very basic and similar every day. I will consider returning to it at any time.

The room I stayed was big compared with the ones at the same rate. It was cleaned every day. It had a small fridge and a kettle. There were also 2 large wardrobes and one of them had a safe. The location of the hotel is excellent with easy access to many places. We loved the location as it is surrounded by many cafes, restaurants (the Asian ones were excellent) and bars to suit all budgets. The Opera Square is a great starting point to see all the tourist attractions. It is easy to get to the hotel from the airport either by metro or bus. Once you get off the bus it is a 4-5 minute walk. The staff were very friendly and all spoke very good English.

The size of the bathroom is bigger than the size of the room :)
Although it may be convenient for Paris in terms of room size, the hotel room is quite small for us and it is difficult to navigate around the room :) Even the door of the room could not be opened all the way (which is weird) because of the luggage rack behind the door.

Location was good- well placed to galeries Lafayette- roughly 7-10min walk
Rooms were spacious- although one of our room had an odor coming from the bathroom- did request for them to fix otherwise switch room. Odor wasn't there the next day, but the remainder of our stay it came back. 
Provided with what a 4 star hotel should provide regarding amenities- although the free filtered refill station is on ground floor which at times, can be a little inconvenient
Bed's were comfortable
Close by to various Asian cuisine- Japanese, Korean, Thai and if you were to walk a further 5-10mins, more were available.
Local Cafe's, Bubble tea shops, chocolatiers and some boutique shops

Close to the Opera metro
Staff were friendly

Easy for Uber/Taxi to access
Close to Louvre Museum and about a 20-30min walk to both Eiffel Tower and Arch de Triumph
Rooms were quiet enough- small balcony outside our bedroom gave it that "French" feeling when you wanted to just stand and take it in- our room was just facing the street with no real view of any landmarks.
Expected to pay a little over the median/average for location- pretty much in the middle of 9th, 8th and 2nd Arr. is pretty good.
We felt safe during the evening strolls
Aside from the odor coming from the bathroom/air vents in one of our rooms and the free filtered water fountain on ground floor- pretty hard to find our dislikes of the place.
Sure, 17 euro per person/day for breakfast was a little hefty- should consider paying for breakfast on a daily basis (like how we did) vs paying for the entire week for it

Et chaque lit est muni d'un equipement coulissant (avec lampe + prise d'electricite... c'est cool !) . Pour l'equipement d'un lit dans un dortoir c'est vraiment sympa (la conception). Neanmoins j'ai paye vraiment cher pour un lit dans un dortoir de 10 personnes .... Rapport qualite/prix c'est un peu trop ! Alors au niveau de l'endroit public comme toilette et douche, je trouvais que tres peu (une chambre avec seulement 2 wc et 2 douche pour 1 etage) ... proprete ca peut aller. Les personnes de Christopher Inn Paris sont super sympas ! Ils sont internationaux ... parlant de langues differents, mais bien sympatiques. En tous cas Christopher Inn Paris est bien sympa !! (surtout il est tout proche de la gare du nord, 5 min a pieds).

You had a choice of breakfasts and we usually had the gourmet which is enormous and generous. It had scambled eggs, sausages, an assortment of meat and cheese, croissants and bread, an assortment of fruit, tea and coffee, warm milk, fruit juices. The yoing staff were extremely friendly and nothing was too much. They booked taxis and recommended local restaurants. Because it ws my birthday they laid on a half bottle of champagne and a gift of gourmet biscuits and dressed the large doube bed with artificial rose petals spelling out HB with a big heart. They also upgraded our room so we had a view over the street instead of the back. A wonderful reception.
The rooms were described as cosy and they were small but had all the facilities you needed including step in shower and hair dryer. The only problem was that they were refurbishing the breakfast room so we had breakfast in our cosy room with a table installed in such a way that you could not fully open the entrance door. As there was only one chair one person had to eat their breakfast on a side table while sitting on the bed.

Friendly staff, very nice looking hotel
Small room

Perfect location for sightseeing, excellent breakfast, helpful staff, relatively spacious room (they let us choose between 3).

Lovely little touches like ponchos, water fans in room. Staff very helpful and friendly.

The room was good, particularly given the fact the building is old and was designed for a different era, so to speak. The breakfast buffet and service was excellent and that adds to the overall value of the hotel.
The building facilities are overall small, but this is due to the fact it is an older building. The spiral staircase is not that easy to navigate, but doable. As stated, this is an older building and that is to be expected.

Great size room, very clean and comfortable. Our room was serviced daily. Staff was great and location was outstanding.

The air conditioning worked well.
I have no complaints; would stay there again.

Coffee from a machine

The bathroom is very narrow and using the walk in shower you cannot avoid water landing on the bathroom floor. (Minor problems for a one night stay). The room was very clean and the bed comfortable. The hotel is very well situated for touring Paris. The staff were extremely polite and helpful.
Scrambled eggs could be better cooked and the bacon should be crispier !

Location fantastic for my taste- walking distance from everything I wanted to see. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast good, room clean
The only drawback was the size of the very tiny room. But it had the essentials and it didn't matter to me.

Clean rooms, nice and cool in the Parisian heat!

Everything! Especially reception staff were so friendly and helpful.
Nothing

The location was amazing. No further than 30 mins away from most attractions, and a few different metro lines within a 10 min walk

Location was great. It was very close to metro and bus stations. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. There was a lot of variety at breakfast and all of them were delicious. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. I would choose the same hotel if I had chance to go to Paris again.

Breakfast was lovely and the location was perfect for our needs

decent breakfast, decent sized room, kind front desk staff,
awkward encounters with cleaning staff (wonder if since cleaning is not mandatory, but can be requested, they are grumpy when we do?), had to find staff to get coffee at breakfast, room had lots of little issues (peeling "wallpaper", no racks in bathroom for towels, no accessible outlets or charging stations along the wall by the heads of the beds.

Proximity to my favourite area in Paris and located in a quiet street with lovely shops and restaurants ; this hotel was a surprise package. The staff were lovely and went out of their way to assist us with our stay. Rooms were full of character and I liked our bathroom very much. Breakfast had a lovely range and the staff in the dining room were also very welcoming. 
I liked particularly how safe I felt and how calm our street was throughout the stay. You are just around the corner from the metro ( Saint Germaine) and a short walk to the Seine Rv.
There is currently no sign above the hotel making it initially difficult to spot from our taxi. Everything was lovely .

Very central. Very comfortable
Nothing

Reception staff very friendly and helpful.
Decor in halls and corridors could do with a refresh.

The location is excellent. I always stay in that area when i visit Paris.
We had a very quiet room with a pleasant view of the rooftops. The staff was friendly and helpful. The cleaning ladies were wonderful. The bathroom was very well appointed and very modern.
The room is TINY, if you are used to American size rooms, you are in for a shock. 
The elevator was also so small, three of us can barely fit without any luggage. The photos on the site are somewhat decieving, check square footage to get a real idea of the room size.

The receptionists were welcoming and very polite, we really appreciated their hospitality.

The breakfast was good, but variety of food could be better. Only one type of bread. No vegetables were available. Only one type of eggs - scramble. Could have at least boiled eggs. Choice of cheeses also was very limited.
Sound isolation in the hotel is not good. You can hear everything happening above and next to you.

Clean & comfortable, great location & staff helpful

This hotel was beautiful, cosy & charming. It was ideal for us for our city break. The rooms were spotlessly clean and they were also serviced daily. It is very central, but also in a lovely quiet area.
Nothing. Rooms & lift are maybe a bit small. But that's being very picky.

Perfect location for exploring the city. Excellent staff, very friendly and helpful. Comfortable room.
Nothing. Everything was great!

An exceptional greeting at reception in a superbly located Parisien hotel. The room was a very reasonable size for a Paris hotel, a lovely, fresh breakfast is served.
Nothing comes to mind.

Shower door needs to be replaced or sealed at the bottom. Lot of water comes out onto the outside floor so when you get out the floor is soaked.

Our check in experience was very nice and the service attendant was friendly. We turned up 2 hours early, the room was ready and they allowed us to check in (very appreciated)!

The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and we got fresh towels daily. The bathroom soap and lotions were nice. Plenty of power outlets available.

There is a service attendant available 24hours, they greeted us no matter what time we returned. We felt very safe at this hotel.

The optional breakfast was offered to us on arrival, we thought it was a reasonable price, but decided against it as we pefer to eat on the go.
The room was located on the third floor, as there are no lifts in the property so we had to carry our bags awkwardly up a spiral staircase.
The room itself is very small with a big desk and chairs, so it is difficult to move around. There is no cupboard available so it felt very small and cramped. 

The bathroom is tiny and the shower leaks onto the floor. We had to use multiple towels to tidy it up. They crank the bathroom towel heater to assist in the wet floors, but if you leave the bathroom door open it make the bedroom uncomfortably warm.

The location of the hotel. I prefer the left bank so this hotel offers proximity to all attraction and restaurants and bars.
The bathroom was a bit worn.

The staff are amazing . They were very helpful with everything I asked . The hotel location is very convenient . The breakfast is delicious. The room and shower are a bit small but it‚Äôs typical for this area in Paris . Very good value !

Loved all the little extras. Exceptional breakfast. Staff very friendly and kind. Great location close to everything we wanted to visit.
Size of room slightly too small otherwise no complaints at all.

Location was wonderful. I had a single room and it was very small but clean .
Small rooms

Everything was expected. The breakfast staff were delightful and helpful.
Better access to the rooms - but it is older building and it was OK.

The hotel was good and we had a pleasant stay overall.
However, the price was significant compared to the value offered by the hotel.

The staff were very warm and helpful. The room was cozy and clean.
It was eventually ok but i didn't know if you book certain rooms in the hotel they don't have access to elevator.

Gret hotel, great staff, good breakfast, fantastic location. The bed are good but 130 cm is not enough for two grown people. Rooms are airconditioned but it was not turned on cetrally while we were there (mid may) and having open windows means a bit of noise when you are in the middle of Paris. 

Will book again, but only if I can get a one of the rooms with a larger bed.

Location, Cleanliness and breakfast
Room size and was little stuffy

The lady at the breakfast ( was really fun & helpfull!

very friendly staff, good breakfast, very clean hotel
the rooms are very small but comfortable and clean

Location great Clarice and Amelia were excellent. They did their best to make us happy. One male staff member instead of helping, always created a road block. He didn‚Äôt make things easy.
Tiny rooms. My husband suffers claustrophobia. They upgraded us when I let them know.

The location was not only central but also safe, convenient to metro, interesting shops and varied dining options. Wonderful thevinin bakery and city pharma 5 minutes walk! We stayed in the family suite and appreciated the unique 2 bedroom split at a great value. This would be perfect accomodation for parents and children. The front desk staff was very helpful with advice and coca-colas. The internet was easy to use and fast.
The family suite is accessible by a very small elevator two people max so sometimes the at added our commute when under a time crunch. The room got quite hot at night and I couldn‚Äôt figure out the temperature controls but I didn‚Äôt ask for help. The windows let in the night air when I needed

This is a nice hotel in the centre of Paris, you can walk to Louvre across the river easily. Paris hotels are notoriously expensive for what they offer, but this one was reasonably priced compared to some other (similar) options in the area. The bedroom was a decent size, as, again, some of the rooms in hotels are ridiculously small. This was not the case here.
Breakfast was OK, although service could be better there.
Breakfast service could be better. We came for breakfast to find the scrambled eggs finished, and it took a while to get a new batch ready. Also you can't pour your own tea or coffee, which also makes you rely on staff to bring you hot water for tea or to bring coffee. So make sure you allow enough time for breakfast as the room is rather small and there might be delays in service.

Also some rooms are not accessible via lift, and the stairs twist and turn so one has to be careful.

Amazing location and breakfast!
Rooms are a bit small

The family room with two connecting rooms was great for our family of four. The location was outstanding and the staff were very nice.
.

Good location, comfortable bed and hot shower

Great location, super friendly staff - they offered free breakfast as the hotel exterior was being renovated (but I didn't hear a thing during the 2 nights I was there, rather got some cool photos of the old sign just outside my window). Very clean and comfortable and decent room size for Paris (have previously stayed in real shoe boxes).
Nothing

Location of was ideal, very easy to get too, beds very comfortable, staff very friendly and helpful.

Small but nice room, great bed. Nice breakfast, nice vibe, great location.

Room was small but what was expected for central Paris. 
Room was lovely and warm. Some renovations going on so it was a bit noisy and scaffolding outside the front of the building in front of our room.

The personal just does it all. The hotel in not perfect, but the people working there are saving the place. I‚Äôm happy i was here.

Room attractively decorated. Nice bathroom, good radiator here.

Locations is great, all the pubs restaurans of st germain area are walking distance and subway/bus station are just 3 minutes away. extremely welcoming staff. Rooms were clean, big enough and quite comfortable. I believe this place deserve more than 8.1 rating.

A wonderful hotel in a Great location. The room had a level of basic Comfort and was a very good value. I liked the traditional interior design, and the breakfast, while optional, was nice. Highly recommend.
The hotel is a little dated, and some rooms have no access by lift, this did not affect me except when checking out with luggage. While the hotel is very quiet to street noise, rooms are close together and noise from adjacent guests, and slamming doors can be disruptive to sleep.

Croissants, Croissants, Croissants, my girls had high expectations for the Croissants, (I mean it's Paris)...
The hotel exceeded the expectations on food and location, quite comfortable too.

Fantastic central location with many beautiful shops restaurants nearby. Exceptionally friendly helpful reception team, you are the best especially Candice. Room with lift access, nicely decorated, quiet. Great location near metro, bus, restaurants. Many sights walking distance.

Excellent location and clean comfy bed and bathroom. Knew it was an attic room but didn‚Äôt know it was three flights of stairs up with baggage! Tiny room tiny circular staircase good breakfast. Cheery front desk staff.

As a first time visitor to Paris, I found the position perfect as most major attractions were within easy walking distance. The hotel was comfortable and the staff were very accommodating and helpful. I would definitely recommend Hotel Des Deux Continents for your Paris stay.
The room was a little bit small but I am told that is normal for Paris. Remember after all we are not here to stay in our room. Enjoy Paris !!!

Well located, nice ambience. Clean rooms and pleasant helpful staff.
Nothing

Situated in Saint-Germain-des-Pres, this hotel is extremely convenient being walking distance from the Louvre and Champs Elysees. The staff are fantastic, helping with small requests and very polite. The small touches in the room such as a water bottle every day were much appreciated.

It was a great experience! Very friendly staff.
Nice rooms, entire decoration/setting of the hotel.
Very convenient location with each 20/30min from the key touristic areas.
Nothing special.
Beds were perhaps too narrow, but for me it was rather cosy ;).

Loved the vibe of the hotel and area. Staff were all helpful. More choice on breakfast would good. Lovely bar and cocktails reasonably priced as resident you get a discount had one of the best pisco sours.
My only gripe is the hanging/storage space very annoying to use and if you are staying more than a couple of days as we were then limited it would be good if they changed this but I know it is to blend with style of hotel.

Great boutique hotel! Lovely stuff & experience overall ‚≠êÔ∏è

Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Bed was very comfortable!

Room decor and ambience and situation.
Just space really, and maybe some milk for the coffee.

The location was perfect, the bedroom great and the bed itself one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The cafetiere and coffee mugs in the room are a lovely touch.

We loved the style of this hotel, it was very cosy. The staff was amazing, very helpful and friendly.
The only inconvenience was that we flew into Paris early and the check-in is only from 16:00. Good thing is they provided a safe storage room for our luggage.

Excellent service in the hotel. Everyone was friendly and approachable.
The setting was very unique and interesting.
No restock of some items on the breakfast bufet.

Beautifully decorated, quaint and quiet, the Babel hotel is a little hidden gem in the heart of Paris.
The check in is at 4pm. A bit late in my opinion.

Lovely aesthetic
Room was quite small. A little uncomfortable due to lack of space. Felt like it should have been nicer for the price paid.

Gorgeous aesthetic and modern touch to the hotel overall, rooms were well serviced with good cooling and heating options, excellent shower and bathroom and great proximity to the nearest train station ( less than 3 minute walk from the hotel)- and you‚Äôll get into the city centre within 20 minutes. So many wonderful eating spots and restaurants nearby too, and a laundromat just around the corner ( about 1‚Ç¨ for washing powder and about 2-3‚Ç¨ for wash + dry) . So convenient.
Limited space in rooms however this is to be expected. We still felt like the room was very well designed and worked well with the space it had. 

Beds were not very comfortable, and were quite hard! Sorry!

Can highly recommend Babel for anyone looking for a simple, relaxing stay in Paris in beautiful surroundings. You can feel that the people behind Babel have cared for the details in making this a comfortable stay for everyone. The staff were very friendly and the rooms had everything we needed. We were pleasently surprised at how calm at quiet it was at night even when our room was facing the street. Lovely place!

Beautifully furnished, very clean and comfortable and a great location

Loved the decor, beds were comfortable, staff friendly

Beautiful hotel, very comfortable beds and perfectly sized rooms. In a great location really close to everything both walking distance and via the metro

Myself and my partner recently stayed at Babel Belleville, which was such a lovely side street hotel. Next to many cafes, bars, supermarkets and the metro within walking distance from the hotel. 

We didn‚Äôt eat at the hotel as we wanted to venture out into the centre of Paris so we could enjoy our experience even more. 

The room itself was very clean, comfortable, warm and spacious. 

We had a very good couple of nights sleep in this hotel and we‚Äôre grateful to have stayed with you. 

Would definitely recommend your hotel to anyone we know going to Paris.
Absolutely nothing.

Brilliant location in the 20th arr. easy to reach the station and central Paris. The 20th is a fantastic area of Paris to explore!
Comfortable, great location and a great atmosphere

Stylish and good location for the metro.
Nothing

It was so Parisian . Very comfortable bed . Excellent breakfast and restaurant. Very quiet room . Warm friendly staff .

location: however the hotel is located somewhat outside of the city center, because metro line 2 is literally around the corner all important sites to visit feel closeby.

as mentioned above, the room was to smaller size, but this didn't bother us since everything was very clean and everything you need is available.

Great staff. Clean rooms, nice atmosphere. Facilities and hotel generally if a high standard. The room was a little small but that comes with a city hotel the restaurant and bar is very nice, romantic. But a top, top boutique hotel but a high quality one.

Room, amenities , very friendly and professional staff , great atmosphere and great location

Friendly staff
Location was amazing

The hotel bar was great, and all the staff were lovely, the breakfast was good too. Nothing really! It wasn‚Äôt as central as some of the more touristy areas, but we really liked Belville, the area, and we would definitely stay here again.

We loved our stay at Babel Belleville. The location was great, the room was lovely and comfy, and we loved that there was no tv but radio/music was the focus of the room! We would definitely stay here again!

Really stylish hotel. Beautifully designed rooms and decor. Vintage Moroccan vibe. Very cool. Plus good location near to lots of wonderful restaurants.

Lovely decor and individual style
Not much room to put clothes

Cozy room, friendly staff and great breakfast

Great vibe, great outside seating, great atmosphere. All the staff were awesome, friendly, helpful.

Everything! We‚Äôve been to Paris so many times and staying in Belleville, and particularly this hotel, made us fall in love with it even more.
Nothing!

The hotel was very clean and well kept with good attention to sustainability! Very friendly staff and overall it was such a good vibe!

The staff was friendly and attentive. Beautiful decor and a nice breakfast. The air-conditioned rooms are clean and small but average (in size) for the city with comfortable beds. Small rooms, but this is normal for the city. The location leaves room for desire, it is very close to the metro but the area has rough edges.

Really great theme, good in hotel restaurant amazing, clean and a great location for metro and for walking if you like a good walk.

I don‚Äôt like n open shower. Water got everywhere. My room also faced the side street so it was a little noisy but I had earplugs so could get some sleep.

Really liked the style of this place with all its little flourishes. The hotel was located in a convenient location for us, very close to a Metro station and with lots of bars and restaurants nearby. The breakfast was a bit limited but we did enjoy having something a bit different to a traditional hotel breakfast. The bed was comfortable and the shower was good. Would be happy to stay here again!
This is probably the case all over Paris but the rooms were very small. Great location, just a very short walk from the metro. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The style of the hotel was just beautiful. I loved my room so much.

Beautiful hotel in a nice quiet street

Very nice cosy hotel, small rooms but comfortable, nice lounge / restaurant area and friendly staff

Look and feel, very good wine list for a hotel bar

Lovely room - much bigger than I thought it would be and in a really great location. 2 mins walk away from metro and loads of good bars and restaurants near by.

Design, soft bed

Location and staff. Comfortable bed.

Staff were very welcoming and attentive, room was perfect clean and well designed with nice details. Overall hotel is very comforting place. Loved the area as well as the Babel restaurant there are also great restaurants and bars around. Would definitely stay again
Hate to say it but I did miss a TV in the room! Also breakfast layout was a bit small and awkward to navigate - could do with extra table or space to rest plate when self serving. Babel is such a cool hotel, with a Middle Eastern vibe decor and cuisine. I really love the vibe, the friendly staff, the cocktails and the neighbourhood of Belleville
Everything was really good. The only thing that was missing were some amenities in the room, like a safety deposit box, minibar and a place to hang a long coat / dress. This would make the room just a bit more comfortable. Keep in mind that if you travel with friends and share a room, the bathroom has a glass door.

Botique, african influence. Beutiful hotel and friendl staff. Great spot for a moody cocktail in the evening. Feels like a hidden gem staying there!

The hotel was very charming and the restaurant downstairs had delicious food. The staff were very helpful. The location is lovely in an alley with cafes and it does not feel too touristy there. It is also right next to the metro. The bed was comfortable, and the service from staff was exceptional.
The room was quite small, and when the window is open, there is a lever that tends to stick out. It is easy to bump into it because the bed is so close, and I got bruises on my leg from that. It would be nice to have a window without that lever if the room is so small.

Cool decor. Quiet, stylish, and comfortable room. Good bed and shower, used the small space well. Really liked the overall vibe. Considerate and welcoming staff too.
Breakfast was fine, but some little touches were lacking (coffee pots empty, syrup and milk missing, no clean mugs), and would have preferred my coffee stronger! Very little things there‚Ä¶

loved this place - great vibe, fun atmosphere, staff is helpful and super cool, definitely return
would love a minifridge in the room so i can store all the yummy things i love to buy in paris but that was the only thing i felt was missing and not even a necessity

Classy, Great staff, lovely bar and restaurant, food / mezze was to die for, good coffee, great cocktails, well decorated, well lit, rooms are small but decorated brilliantly, shower is great, rooms really fantastic and in Paris, most hotel rooms are generally small anyway, but couldn‚Äôt fault it, at all, I will stay there next time 100%
nothing

The decor, the atmosphere, the staff,

Fantastic location, and price. Right next to the metro station (line 11 and 4) that gets you straight into the main areas of Paris within 10-15 mins.

Quiet backstreet, and very well decorated hotel. 

Later 12pm checkout as standard was nice after a few busy days in Paris seeing the sights. 

The bar area, and staff were fantastic, very pleased with our stay and would return again!
N/A

Location was great gave us a real insight into Parisian life. Staff were amazing, hotel was chilled and well looked after.
Nothing

The staff at this hotel may be the friendliest and most helpful that we have ever met. They went out of their way to help us. The location was ideal as it was just off of a boulevard and 50 yards from the Belleville Metro. There were numerous restaurants of all types within short walking distance and it was very easy to access all of the major sites of Paris. The breakfast was excellent even though it was the same each day. We can't say enough about how wonderful the staff is. The bar/restaurant was a real active/fun spot.
The room was a little small if a traveler has much luggage and the breakfast was the same each day, even though it was very great.

I appreciated the positive attitude and the service of the personnel; they were all very welcoming. The room was cosy and had a unique character. Attention to detail was obvious everywhere. The restaurant served delicious dishes.
The rooms are quite small (as everywhere in Paris) and the portions of the dishes were on the small side as well. Or could it be that they were so delicious that I wanted more?

What a pleasure to stay at Babel - we did not want to leave! 

The staff were just fantastic and the food (we tried both breakfast and dinner), the beautiful decor, hospitality and ambiance was just superb. Nothing was too much to ask; from ice, to chargers to taxis to extra pillows, the team went above and beyond for us and always with such friendly service. 

A true Parisien experience in an exciting and vibrant neighbourhood - highly recommended. 

Thanks again guys - merci and with love from Afrique du Sud ‚ù§Ô∏è

Staff was friendly, room was very clean and comfortable would recommend to anyone

Location amazing and very cool.
Coffee at breakfast could have been better, but that really didn't matter

Very unique style of the hotel, great attention to detail. Great Location, easy to access from Gare Du Nord and visit all main attractions in Paris. Hotel provided a great breakfast selection.
rooms could have racks for the suitcases rather than just laying stuff on the floor. There were only few hangers for clothes and no hooks for coats/smaller bags.

The breakfast was excellent, rooms stylish and neighbourhood lively.
The rooms were small - but that is to be expected in Paris.

Tucked away in a quiet pedestrian street in the residential neighbourhood of Belleville is this little hotel full of character and charm. Babel is full of surprises to say the least! 
Mum and I checked in late afternoon so we decided to have dinner downstairs in the restaurant instead of going out anywhere that night, we sat in the quirky little restaurant to find that all within the next 30 minutes or so it was full to the brim. Our dinner was served and I must say it was absolutely Divine! We were gobsmacked by just how good it was 
The hotel has a Moroccan vibe and the restaurant too, the bed is like sleeping on a cloud, the staff incredibly friendly and the style is an eclectic mix of found objects, cool artwork and personal touches that add to the homely vibe. 
Super cute, super comfortable. The metro is a 2 minute walk from the hotel, so convenient. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay, I was sad to leave.
The foyer / cafe floor could really do with a good clean, it's the first thing I noticed as I walked in. The neighbourhood and surrounding back streets are littered with graffiti and a bit dodgy looking, but we never felt unsafe walking to the hotel at night. On first impressions I wouldn't let this deter you as the hotel itself is charming.

On the outskirts of central paris, but in a very friendly and lively area, and super close to metro station. Incredibly nice customer service from everyone. Very cosy and comfortable rooms, super quiet since no rooms on street. Great breakfast in a large patio.

The room, staff, breakfast, and location were all incredible.

I loved the interior design of the hotel. It felt really special compared to other touristy hotels. Breakfast was available each morning, and when we were able to enjoy it, it was delicious. The location is right next to the metro, so even though it's not super close to most tourist attractions, it was very easy to get around. The bed was extremely comfortable and the hotel was peacefully quiet.
The rooms were quite small which I expected in Europe, but it would have been nice to have a few extra hooks to hang our coats, towels and other items on. I would have loved a shelf or two in the shower as well for all our toiletries.

Lovely staff, beautiful atmosphere and decor. We loved the common areas for breakfast and a drink in the evening. The bedroom decor was also very beautiful, small but very lovely and super comfy beds.
We had no room to unpack clothes for 3/4 days it was a little small for us just to have 4 hangers in an open shelf and in future stays we'd probably need to stay in a room that had more clothes storage space to be more comfortable but for 2 nights, it's fine and a lovely comfortable room if you don't need to unpack a case.

The location, the ambience, the staff. The breakfast was fantastic.
A television, although it forced me to read more :-)

(3) Location ideal

(1) Basin IN bedroom and very close to the bed
