The breakfast , decor , the staff was very helpful and assorted me with an emergency dentist appointment and many other fun day trip bookings

All very friendly and hotel well situated for getting around. Right next to metro
All fine

Staff was very helpful
Pretty small space but We managed

The room was bigger than expected, clean and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall a great place to say for a city break!
There could have been a few more options at breakfast and some additional amenities in the room.

The staff is super cool. The interior is very beautiful. Everything is very clean. Nice place to spend some more time - maybe dinner or wine in the evening.
Delicious breakfast, although not for people on a diet trying to loose weight, but then again - who goes to Paris to loose weight ü§™ metro stop is around the corner, so it‚Äôs quite convenient. I highly recommend üëè

Great location, easy to get to from the Eurostar, with many restaurants, bars and cafes close by. The hotel is beautifully decorated, the beds are comfy and the tea leaves, coffee plunger and homemade biscuits in the room are a lovely touch.

Lovely, quirky place - fantastic atmosphere. Small touches in the rooms were lovely, very comfortable bed. Young enthusiastic staff and great music in the restaurant. Very mixed neighbourhood, with little shops and small businesses, easy walking distance to Place La Republic and very close to transport. Great spot.

The atmosphere and the smell of the hotel was very pleasant.
The room was very small.

Babel was like a little oasis in Paris, the hotel is super charming, the staff are very helpful and polite and the room, although small, is very comfortable! The bed makes you feel like you‚Äôre sleeping in the clouds and the decoration is incredible, everything thought out to the smallest details to have an artsy touch, which is the highlight of staying in Belleville. The neighborhood is absolutely beautiful, with several open-air galleries, many restaurants and cafes that have a touch of Paris that goes beyond the obvious. We hope to come back very soon!
Everything was perfect

Everything was perfect !!! The staff was very kind ! Bar man was kind and helpful! Even the soap and body lotion was amazing ! Congratulations
Everything was perfect, maybe the breakfast could have more options ! But its ok

great staff, great restaurant, cool hotel
Price very high and location a bit on the outskirts, but center very easy to reach by metro

The hotel is lovely and special. The food from the restaurant is absolutely delicious. The location is only a few metro stops from all the popular neighborhoods and sites. But most importantly the staff were so warm and welcoming. Taking the best care of me during my entire stay. I can't wait to go back.

Can‚Äôt recommend this hotel enough - great location in a busy and vibrant area yet not noisy at night (we had a room at the back of the hotel). The rooms are compact but really well designed from both a functional and aesthetic perspective - lots of attention to details that really make you feel at home. Like many others, we loved the music in the bar and enjoyed a delicious cocktail there before heading out to dinner.
Nothing we disliked

Staff was fantastic and incredibly helpful. The hotel is beautiful and designed with great attention to detail. Will 100% return next year.
Breakfast was delicious but maybe a bit more diversity and variety of choices. Prices for apparel and souvenirs.. If you could call it that are a bit excessive but then again nobody is forcing you to get them. There's no fridge and it would be great to have one but It seems like this is common in 3 even 4 stars hotels in Paris (not sure whyü§∑)

The decor was great. Lovely and clean. Nice vibe. Close to the metro. Food was good.
Rooms are a bit small but I think this is normal in Paris.

The atmosphere in the hotel was very pleasant, and the rooms are beautifully decorated. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Close to the subway, friendly staff, unique decor I could go on and on‚Ä¶. You name it they had it.
My husband didn‚Äôt like the hangers lol‚Ä¶

A real gem. Unique middle eastern theme offering great value, location and value. Situated in the buzzy Belleville area of the 20th arr. Not a real tourist area which made it all the better. Buzzy bars, local restaurants and a busy asian food quarter.
Breakfast is a limited continental style but nice all the same.

the style/architecture- very well accurate in all details - breakfast excellent simple but all you need 
: coffee, croissant bred jam yogurt super fresh orange juice - i asked for early check in they said 12 - I arrived at 10 AM and got immediately the room- brilliant
room little bit tiny -however for Paris standard is reasonable

Babel is an unusual hotel. It is decorated in a North African way, which is absolutely charming. The lift recites poetry relating to the Tower of Babel when going up and down. The room is spotless with nice decorations. Breakfast is excellent, detox juice, ghia pudding. Staff very friendly. Excellent location in very multicultural Belleville.
The room is not very practical. Nowhere to put your cases, hang your clothes or towels. We had to move the lovely decorations and coffee and tea facilities to the corner of a high shelf to make room for personal belongings. The trendy shower taps were stiff and it took us a while to work them out.

The property was thoughtfully decorated, clean, near local bars and restaurants, and right near a metro station

I love the authentic atmosphere of the hotel! You can feel Paris mood in every small detail. Room is tiny but very cozy. Near by the hotel there is a metro station so you can easily reach any place in Paris! We enjoyed a lot, I would recommend this hotel.

I'm absolutely in love with this hotel! Such a pleasant stay, amazing breakfast!!! Design is impeccable. Tea pot, variety of tea and coffee inside the room. No shampoo and conditioner tho, but otherwise nice soap, clean room and pleasant smell around. Location is close to Saint Martin, Le Marais. Very hype and cool.

Everything was fabulous! The bedroom, the furniture, the bathroom, the teas in the room, the dedsign, the open roof, the place, the restaurant!! The position, the staff, the breakfast was a sexy experience to make... I loved everything!

I didn['t have the breakfast.

Very cool place. Such friendly, welcoming staff, beautiful interior design and fab food and cocktails. Shakshuka and fresh juice at breakfast were both delicious.
There wasn't much not to like. It's a great hotel. My only grumble was that the room was tiny and not well designed for storing luggage or hanging clothes. This is more of a one night stay kind of place. But the do look beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. Other rooms might be larger.

Great location. Amazing decor. Great bed and nice and clean

This place was fabulous all around, great location, nice staff, good coffee.

Babel Bellville was wonderful.

Location was superb ( right next to Bellville station - easy train ride to everywhere in Paris ) - it's about a 20 minute train ride to the Louvre / half hour to Eiffel Tower

Staff was so kind & sweet : went out of their way to accommodate ( i.e. room amenities, coffee, etc.)

Room itself was nice size for Euro standards and very modern ( only oddity was lack of TV - which was fine because our goal was to see Paris rather then watch TV )

Breakfast was awesome - delicious variety of traditional French breakfast 


Helpful Tip : 

* Confirm what is included in hotel breakfast ( somethings maybe additional charge )
* Room's lack of TV ( though turned out to be a plus - started date earlier )

Very clean and stylish, great location, most stuffs are very nice. They have a nice bar downstairs.
The WiFi was broken for hours the first day I stayed. One of the stuff, the bold guy is really rude to me when serving breakfast!!!

Design, mattress quality

Well located and easy to check in. Room had a lovely view and was comfortable, clean and quiet
The included breakfast. Was very average - stale pastries, bad coffee and service was slow and inattentive

We have enjoyed our stay at Babel so much. The room is really pretty, big and comfortable bed and all the amenities are well thought. Keep in mind that there isn't a fridge in the room so you can't storage food that way. The air conditioning was working perfectly and we really liked the vibe of the entire place.
We have been a bit disappointed in the way breakfast was, as in you have a few things included in the price you pay for the accomodation (1 croissant/person, a little bit of butter and jam, some bread and you get to choose between chia with granola, yoghurt with fruits and some other thing). If you are a fan of a breakfast that includes eggs and bacon and other stuff like that, you can have them but you have to pay separately for them. Maybe, as an unsolicited advice for them, provide for breakfast the classic options people are used to combined with french specialties to give it a flare :)

Lovely, clean, friendly staff. Felt unique & chic.

Close to the underground.
Bar wasn‚Äôt open on a Monday evening.

Stylish, comfortable and charming

Staff were exceptional! Very stylish hotel

Staff were amazing and breakfast was quite good also. Loved the decor... So much attention to detail.
We were a bit disappointed that the restaurant/bar was closed while we were there but we understand that this is common in August in Paris.

It‚Äôs confortable

Mood, atmosphere, people, style, breakfast, music. 
A really special hotel!
Nothing.

The hotel is in a great location super close to the metro so really easy to get around. Loved the decor and general mood of the place, very cozy and warm! The Breakfast was charming and straightforward, would set you up for the morning - a selection of fresh juices and all presented on cute ceramics, I enjoyed the atmosphere very much. Option for dinner if you want to eat in, would definitely recommend at least eating in once. Staff was super helpful and nice.
I would have liked for the breakfast to change a little, maybe in terms of different pastries or options. Would have really liked a small fridge in the room. But overall really happy with everything.

Everything was clean and well decorated, also the bed was super comfortable!

Very friendly and helpful staff, beautiful design and great location next to the metro station! The restaurant bar with terrace is also really nice. the desserts were amazing. definitely recommend if you want to explore Paris from a less touristic, but more local area close to
the touristic city centre.

Love the ambience and styling of the rooms and hotel.
Great staff.
Location, a little too far from the centre.

Friendly staff, nice vibes, cute aesthetics, nice to grab a drink on the terrace. Good food.
mold in the shower and no cold water in the room‚Äôs sink

Friendly and accommodating staff. The bathroom and shower were really large for Paris, the room was comfortable, the little cookies in the room when we arrived were super cute! The only thing I wish was that we had more time to check out the restaurant.
We love walking around Paris so we did a lot of meeting people closer to the seine by walking 45 mins to an hour or so - if you want to be right in the heart of things then this might not be for you. On the other hand there are tons of cafes and restaurants closer by and the little cobblestone block where you enter is really sweet.

Everything was excellent
Nothing

Friendly staff, comfortable rooms. Loved the French style breakfast with optional extras (Extra cost). Unlimited coffee :)
Several of the plug sockets didn‚Äôt work in the room

Very clean, extremely comfortsble bed, nice shower etc
Perhaps lack of TV (but not essential) and poor breakfast - in particular the croissants.

Nice location close to subway. Everything clean and reception staff very nice and helpful.

I loved the location. was easy to navigate around Paris. I loved the people. they made my stay so special. they were always willing to help.
there wasn‚Äôt anything I didn‚Äôt like.

So close to a Metro station and just off a main boulevard. This is a secret slice of heaven. Very tasteful decor and the restaurant below is sublime. Fabulous staff.
Nothing.

I booked the Babel Belleville for me and my friends and they whopped when they saw the room! The decor, the special touches, OMG. The breakfast they offered wonderful immune boasting juices. Our dinner was one of the best we had in Europe! We are all artists who did a 3 week tour from Paris to Prague, with stops in between. Bellville with an alley down the block delighted us. Wish I booked more than one night.
Can't think of one thing!

The layout and decor

The property was amazing, a perfect amalgamation of Moroccan and West Indian influence. The entire design is implacable. We stayed at a very expensive hotel before this and I actually preferred Babel. It oozes character and the staff were amazing. The breakfast was also delicious. Perfect for a couple visiting Paris.

The hotel was lovely and quirky. The food was amazing in the hotel, highly recommend eating there. the staff were nice and friendly.
The rooms are quite small, we did request a double bed as it was a mother and daughter trip but we‚Äôre given a double bed to share. the shower temperature was quite cold as well.

the location was perfect, just outside central
Paris in a vibrant neighborhood. the staff were exceptional!
cannot think of any negatives

I liked the vibe and decor

We were more than satisfied with our room and its state, the room service and especially the breakfast options. All staff were very friendly and accomodating, good athmosphere. Great place to come back to at the end of the day, hopefully we'll have reason to stay at Babel another time!

Babel is this cute getaway hotel that has this amazing breakfast with freshly squeezed orange juice or detox juice. We loved their Chia seed pudding and freshly baked croissants .
We had one of the biggest rooms but we were struggling to keep our suitcases open. I guess European hotels are comparatively smaller than US hotels

perfect location next to the metro
verrryyy comfortable bed
nice vibe and decoration
great breakfast
original cocktails 
feels lively all day
the team at breakfast seems a bit overwhelmed

good vibe
no tv in room

The room was nice and comfortable. The breakfast was delicious.
The district is really dodgy, I would never recommend staying there if you travel alone as a female or a gruop of female friends. I went out alone to get some water from the supermarket around the corner at around 9pm and was attacked by a black guy trying to get something from me. Fortunatelly, a busy bar was just a few meters away so I rushed there and he didn't chase. the district seemed dangerous from the first moment we stepped out of the metro and I would never stay there again. Also, the breakfast that's included in the price is quite small, only a croissant, a little dessert and some bread. All the extras such as eggs or cheese are not included and you have to pay extra for each, which was in a way unpleasant and unexpected. Perhaps it's just a Parisian thing, that they will always charge you for everything, but early chack-in was also priced at 20‚Ç¨ for after 12pm and 40‚Ç¨ for earlier than that. Which the receptionist didn't mention in our chat earlier when I asked for it.

Lovely hotel with very nice staff. Rooms are comfy and clean. Breakfast was good. Located in a more residential area and not so touristy. Easy to reach any part of Paris from there. The tube was just 100 m away.

Location fantastic. Room larger than I was expecting.
Cigarette smoke from the street coming up into the window.

this is a very special hotel

Really liked the atmosphere, the interior design was excellent and the place was overall really nice!
Some noises heard from the street. Didn't mind us but for a light sleeper it could be an issue.

The room was very cozy, clean and comfortable.

It has alot of history to it. The structure is both ancient and modern. We love the environment.
i will recommend.
The receptionist who wears glasses and speaks good English was very helpful.
Expensive drinks at the bar.

Good water pressure in shower and close location to metro. I was able to leave my luggage at the hotel prior to the check-in time.
The room was smaller than the smallest room on a cruise ship. The breakfast was a basic continental (mostly bread). Couldn't get the room warm even after setting the thermostat to heat.

Awesome interior, friendly people, excellent accessibility by metro. Cozy & hygienic rooms.
No TV in the room

Really cool hotel!

The property is unique and beautiful! We had lunch there and it was healthy and delicious! The staff is amazing and very accommodating! I will definitely return again
Rooms are a bit small. The Belleville metro is very close but there‚Äôs no escalator or elevator at the metro exit, so slightly difficult carrying our luggage. But this is not reflective on the hotel. The hotel is very nice.

The food was amazing. Loved the atmosphere at the restaurant in the evenings. The food was very fresh, simple, delicious.

stylish hotel. very close to metro. wifi works very well and shower works great
there were many electric sockets but not all of them works. especially the one where electric kettle is! Asked reception on the first evening. we stayed 4 nights and nothing happened. Drinking glasses in the room were not being clean everyday. One day the bed was not made!

Location was very good ! Metrostation Belleville around the corner, supermarket also (if you are in need of something) - Staff very friendly, hotelroom very cozy. good shower and toilet. hotelroom pretty small though and no tv (for us no problem, we don‚Äôt watch tv)
One minus, the little sink to wash your face, hands or brush your teeth. It was too small, everything around it got wet.

it was very quirky and very clean, the staff where very helpful and pleasant.
it was a bit far away from the centre but we managed to work out the metro so wasn‚Äôt that bad.

Love the room, the style and the sent
Rooms are a bit chilly and lighting in the shower a bit when you travel with someone. Hard to sleep if someone showers.

Liked the

Artsy room

nice hotel near metro stop. clean, friendly.
/

Lovely styling, felt very Parisienne.
Liked that our two rooms were interconnected but also separated by a little corridor.
Only that the location felt a bit grungy. But that‚Äôs exactly why it‚Äôs a bit more affordable, and it was very easy to access everywhere by metro.

wonderful decor, the rooms were relaxing - simple yet have an element of luxury which is great for a stay in Paris! lovely staff and restaurant food was delicious.
nothing really. Clean and cosy room, pleasant interrior.
Helpful and friendly staff

lovely clean rooms and very friendly staff

exactly like the pics and staff very polite
it could use more storage but for a short trip is amazing

Comfortable bed, clean, well decorated room and the hotel location is on the very quite part of the Belleville Boulevard, altough not the perfect location if you prefer in the city center but the Metro station is just 150 metre away. The staff's are very friendly
I missed a cupboard or cabinet in the room and the breakfast was a down side.

Wow. This place is like a very thoughtfully decorated and comfortable alternative universe--an oasis. From the quality of the restaurant and bar products, to the music played, to the decor choices, and the staff, it's just superb overall. A very unique place in all the best ways.
Not much to say here, as this was a very satisfying stay.

Hotel with good interior in good location
Breakfast is only coffee with croissant and one dessert. Meals like eggs or similar are with extra charge

Very clean and well decorated. The location was perfect for experiencing a less traveled part of Paris for tourists.
Rooms were a tiny bit small but nothing we couldn‚Äôt adapt to.

Great decor and atmosphere. Very friendly and unpretentious. Helpful and nice staff.
Rooms were a tad tiny but appropriately reflects price point.

The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and nice.
I didn‚Äôt like the space of the room, it was a bit too small for 2 people. We didn‚Äôt have where to put our things, basically we left them in the luggage.

very cozy space and a nice feel. super nice staff and easy check in and out.
missing a bit of storage space for personal items at the room. and the room I was in was troubled with notices from the elevator and other guest yelling goodnight getting off the elevator throughout the night.

super affordable for the standard and vibe of boutique hotel
nothing

staff were very helpful and always happy. they were able to help with a medical problem and advise nearest pharmacy.
Room and hotel was just as pictures show ‚Ä¶ pretty boutique. Bed was really comfy and peaceful at night for a good sleep.
Nothing

The front desk staff (a very tall and black guy, forgot to ask his name) was super helpful and friendly. Gave me directions to supermarket and pharmacy. The breakfast was not too good, you have to pay ¬£6-8 to get egg. Location was fine, close to metro, but in general it was not too close to many tourist attractions.

I loved the hotel! Nice vibe, friendly and helpful stuff, comfortable room and beautiful breakfast!!! Would definitely recommend it!!
A bit far from the city center if on foot, but is just 20m from the metro station and the connection is very good.

The staff and aesthetics.

the location and the staff
the room was too small for a luggage rack - nowhere to put our luggage and get in / out of it comfortably

Stylish and original decor and well equipped comfortable rooms, there was even a blue tooth speaker. Staff were very friendly and helpful.
The bathroom was a little small, location was a little way from the centre of town but right next to a Metro stop.

great location very close to Bellville metro

Fabulous location, close to metro and lots of restaurants. Staff spoke English and were so helpful. Really appreciated the tea and coffee making facilities in the room
Room a little small but very comfortable

Friendly staff. Good location close to the Metro. Well maintained with nice North African decor.
Limited cupboard and hanging space in the room. Pillows a bit small.

Warm and welcoming staff, really friendly and helpful. Beautifully decorated hotel and great food. Highly recommend!
Nothing!

the most incredibly friendly staff. super clean and very new facilities. interesting neighborhood and wonderful diversity of shops and open air market. not even a two minute walk to the metro station to explore all of Paris.
nothing.

Amazing hotel in a really edgy and interesting part of town. Right next door to the Metro which takes you everywhere and some great restaurants and bars close by. The staff were all incredibly friendly and so was the cat who will join you for breakfast. We will definitely come back.
Nothing

The lovely location, gorgeous room, fabulous showers and great staff.
Nothing I can think of!

The staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved the style of the rooms. Breakfast was served in charming millieu of the hotel restaurant. We would like to stay here again, when in Paris.

The lobby smells amazing, the staff are lovely, the location is super close to the metro, and it has a great vibe. They do turn down your room each day while you are away which has become a rare amenity since Covid hit. We really enjoyed the chia pudding at breakfast. The room was good sized by Parisian standards (hotel rooms here are microscopic). I would not hesitate to stay here again on my next trip to Paris!
There is a cute cat who hangs out in the breakfast area sometimes. If you are severely allergic that is just something to be aware of.

Friendly staff, good location, comfortable stay

The staff were exceptional! So friendly and always ready to help with anything we needed. Breakfast was lovely, the croissants were very tasty, and the tea was great. It is right around the corner from the metro station. The decor in the hotel is beautiful, especially in the dining area.
I only had a couple of issues, both of which aren't really a big deal. The shower door was transparent and opposite to the bed, probably fine for couples, but not great for friends/family members. The coffee was also not to my taste personally, but of course, this is just personal preference.

Clean and modern room. Staff very pleasant. No noise at night. Close to metro.

lovely design, great food, super close to the metro & very friendly staff
nothing!

good shower, good air conditioning, good location close to the metro , nice breakfast.
Good restaurant recommendations and nice food in the hotel.
not enough hanging space but we managed

Good location, very clean and the hotel had a really lovely aesthetic.
Small room (although we knew this when booking the property), overall great stay!

The decor was great, nice use of space in the rooms. Restaurant/bar onsite is great. Location was good, very close to the Metro, very interesting neighbourhood, good restaurants in the area.
Beds were a tad bit small

Great location and loved the area. Family room was prefect as it's split into two so you don't have to sit in the dark! Restaurant closed as we were there on a Monday so disappointed not to eat there but highly recommended.

Beautiful room and decor
Very clean and well maintained 
Staff on the front desk were lovely
Excellent location, such a great neighborhood and around the corner from the Metro

Wonderful property with great location and amazing staff.
Nothing

The staff was so friendly. They called cabs and made an excellent recommendation for a nearby bakery. We were in easy walking distance to Bon Marche and La Grande Epicerie.

Picked it for its traditional feel and it did not disappoint, lovely touches everywhere. Located in vibrant area and 2 mins walk from two metro lines.

Room by the street are very noisy

The front staff were all so welcoming and friendly. Everyone spoke English well so communication was never a problem. 
And a bonus that no one has mentioned is that from our room (62) we could see the Eiffel Tower sparking!!
Everything was great

Loved the location and the general feel of the place - felt very safe and cosy
It was a little old and worn, and no aircon at that time of year.

Excellent location, extremely quiet room and comfortable bed!

The hotel was lovely, very charming. Staff was amazing!
Location was fantastic! 
When my husband needed a doctor, the managing Director Veronique quickly made an appointment with our Colette cardiologist within three hours of our need. 
We would certainly stay there again when in Paris, and recommend it to anyone considering staying a stay in Paris
Location, charm, friendly, professional staff.

Food choices through the day! Only breakfast available!

What a beautiful hotel. Pristine clean, spacious room with a leafy green courtyard for our personal use. It was decorated with antique furniture and a had a very comfortable bed. There were fresh flowers waiting for us as well as some other goodies for us to enjoy. The hotel was located perfectly within walking distance to all the major attractions, cafes and restaurants around Paris. The staff were all lovely and very helpful. They also provided a very good breakfast in a unique stone walled space downstairs. Highly recommended.
No mini bar in the room but that was not a big deal.

Beds and bedding comfortable, charming hotel, staff very friendly and helpful, safe, wonderful neighborhood, nice bathroom
A little warm some nights but if we opened our windows in the morning it was cool for the next night. Sometimes a bit loud on the street, so kept windows closed in the evening while sleeping.

The staff was very helpful on all shifts. Mr. Moustache had a great demeanor - professional, friendly and very helpful. The location is perfect for restaurants n shopping. The bed n shower pressure were amazing. Perfect for a single traveler!
Street noise is loud. The place could use a fresh coat of paint.

Great location in the St. German district (6th) located one block from the metro. Was on a quiet street with many restaurants nearby. The staff were great with particular mention of Thomas.
It‚Äôs a bit pricey, but you truly get what you pay for.

Gives an authentic french ambience, furniture and decorative features are very traditional, centrally located to everything (venues such as the Louvre, catacombs, Calife dinner, seine cruises, Norte dame, multiple parks, museums, restaurants) all very walkable. Staff is wonderful. We had fresh beautiful roses on our last night. They have a lovely lobby with free coffee and tea all day! (Yes, an expresso machine), umbrellas if you need to borrow one for the day (super helpful on those rainy days). The cleaning crew is phenomenal and very friendly, they will exchange a full bottle of water for an empty one. The hotel is 2 small blocks away from the metro. The two lovely gentlemen you see on the website are the same ones you see every morning! They are sweet, helpful and very professional. The entire staff is amazing. We loved the experience so much, we booked the hotel again after coming back from Italy. We will definitely come back to this hotel again!
Super small elevator but honestly it added more charm to the place! We thought it was so cute and two people with luggage fit just fine

Everything! Staff exceptional, breakfast perfect, room large and clean.

All the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is ideally situated in the heart of Paris. Our room was a good size and a very comfortable bed. We also had a kettle and tea making facilities in our room. Breakfast was excellent and served by a very friendly staff member.

The staff was excellent. They are helpful and hospitable. We received help in making dinner and taxi reservations. The rooms were delightful and the bed was very comfortable. They also serve a delicious breakfast.

It is amazing to have a quiet lovely room with a green Terasse in the middle of Paris. Magic! Staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast delicious.

This is the perfect boutique hotel for a short stay in Paris. The neighbourhood is one of the best in the city, in my opinion, and everything we wanted was very close to hand. The staff are gracious and friendly, the rooms are well decorated and clean; a little on the small side but then it's Paris. We loved the way that the breakfast came served to our room with not a plastic container in sight! Everything carefully and thoughtfully laid out in little dishes and on a nice tray. We will come back, definitely.

Everything! First impression was the staff, they were so kind and polite. Next was the reception area, it was clean and tidy, they also have a coffee machine (which is really good) and a tiny backyard to spend some time. Reception staff were able to arrange an early check-in for me as I arrived earlier and provided me with a city map which was helpful. The room was very fresh and clean, everything was there. Bed and pillows were so soft and comfortable to sleep in. We wrote a note that we wanted a room on the top floor and they were able to arrange it for us, so we enjoyed the view of the top of Eiffel tower in the evenings. The location was very livable, there are a lot of cafes and restaurants nearby, a shopping centre is 7min by walk and Luxembourg park is 10min by foot. Although, there many places to eat and drink, the street is always quite, no noise at all. We have a wonderful stay there!

We paid 4 star prices and got a 2-3 star room. Our room was tiny, much smaller than shown on the web site. There was about 1 foot clearance between the bed and the wall. The room was so tiny it did not even have a chair, and they had to use the tiny nightstand on the side of the bed for the coffee service. You could not open the bathroom door without rearranging things because there was no room for luggage. The safe was on the floor of the closet. My wife and I felt so cramped we left a night early.

The toilet is separate private room, struggled to understand this on the photos before going (Not a negative for hotel, but for booking.com). The corridor to the to the room was quite creepy, really long, dark and narrow- we paced it at speed everyday. Was charged 4euro for 2 bottles of water, but wasn't told about charge until check out, not a biggie but a bit annoying.

Me and other guests were robbed from the hotel safe!!!!!! 
I came to Paris and stayed at this hotel. First of all staff is not present 24/7 so from the get go i didn‚Äôt feel very secure at night as the loby was often empty. I put money in the safe on the first day, and the money I put in was a very specific amount that was not to be spent in Paris, and thus I kept it in the safe over my 4 day stay. On the last day I realized that while my safe was closed it still opened and 200 euros were missing. Naturally I thought maybe I miss counted my money but other hotel guests quickly expressed that they also had money missing from the safe. I am so disappointed and terrified and to be honest I feel so violated. I spoke to the manager of the hotel and he completely dismissed me, yelled at me and the other guests who also had money stolen. We are currently in contact with the paris police to resolve this issue. While the manager was rude and unhelpful - the receptionists and day staff were friendly and really felt for us. 

Please do not come to this hotel and be safe!!!!!

Great value for money, convenient location (5-7minute walk from subway), friendly and helpful staff, life-saving AC during the Paris heatwave, tiny but cozy room ideal for a good night's sleep before exploring the city.

This hotel has a great location and clean. Perfect for a city break

The staff was super friendly, and the location was ideal - only a 20 min walk from the Eiffel Tower

possibilty of parking

The staff were friendly and accommodating. 
The location was good because it was near the train station.

The aircon wasn't working well. It wasn't able to cool the room. Even if it was on, the room was still hot therefore, we had to open the window.

the rooms were a little small

Well organised in the apartment, comfortable, near of Subway and places to eat, no unuseful free stuff that will just become trash like skin lotions or soap, etc
Two times an alarm started in the middle of the night and stop fastly.

Hotel is in a very handy location - minutes from two train stations and about 15 min from the tower. Also good coffee just around the corner and staff was super friendly, let us in way earlier because the previous guest did not show up. Breakfast is decent and the room is clean. Bed and pillows are comfortable. Lift is small (it only fits two people) but I won‚Äôt add this to the cons as I think this adds character to the building :) Some people complain the room is too small or the lift but this is centre Paris and an old building, you need to do your research so you know what to expect.
Only thing I would mention is the carpet is quite old but I believe they are replacing it in the rooms as on other rooms we saw it was laminate instead. Also shower can be quite slippery when you drop soap on the floor while showering.

location is great and convenient. metro is right across the road.
room is small, elevator do not take more than one person at a time.

The staff was super friendly, many thanks to Roselie for making our stay comfortable. She is the best. This hotel is close to Eiffel Tower, you can reach there by walk in 10 minutes. Even Louvre museum is not so far away if one enjoys to walk for 40 minutes, one can take short breaks in between as there are many nice places in between and also a great view of Eiffel tower from distance.
One can always whine about things but I would really like to thank all the staff for their dedication and hard work, please keep up the good work. Nothing in particular that I didn't like. One suggestion though please add one mirror in the room, it will help big time and if possible add scrambled eggs in your breakfast menu :)

Good location, affordable, comfortable bed, everything you need.
there were some ants in the bathroom.

Very friendly and professional staff, always helpful

great staff :)

the room was clean and quiet and near the hotel you can find many metro stations that lead to the heart of the city
the wifi network that is provided, is an open network without password and that means that if you get connected, you might experience security issues on your devices

This hotel is very close to the metro. We felt comfortable and the apartment was charming. And the bed was comfortable also. It was as pictured and very clean. The check in was easy and staffs are friendly
There was only one little towel, and there was no tooth paste, soap and shampoo in the washroom.

The staff was very friendly and the location is good. The room was clean with comfortable bed.
The room was clean but the furniture in the room was quite old except the bed which looked relatively new and was comfortable. The room was clean but a new carpet and new paint of the wall could make it nicer. The bathroom looked relatively new and clean.

Great staff and location, didn‚Äôt have any breakfast
Quieter

I liked the room and the view. The hotel has a fantastic location since it's pretty close to the Eiffel Tower, there's no need to take public transport to get there. The staff was friendly and supportive as well.
I didn't like the size of the room and bathroom, it was quite small. I guess room sizes in Paris aren't the best given the fact that the city is quite touristic and full of people. Overall cleanliness could have been better as well.

The location is near to M6 and M10.
staffs were so friendly.
the elevator and stairs were tiny. ideal for a single person

very friendly staff
helpful and polite

Staff are very accommodating 
Thsnk you Rosalie

location was good, workers are friendly. kruvasan was delicious in the entrance of lobby. the room was clean
the price is high. and there was no slipper.

Very accessible to UNESCO Office. Staff, especially in the reception area, are very friendly and always ready to help.
I love the croissant always ready in the afternoon after a day's work. Congratulations!

The staff are friendly.
The elevator is too small.

Very central and comfortable

Loca»õia excelentƒÉ

Small but quiet, clean and hot ! if you don't like it cold, this place doesn't cut on heating bills.

great quiet location, near metro, Eiffel Tower..
thin walls

The location is amazing. Close to the metro (line 6,10) lot of restaurants around and easy to go to the Eiffel Tower.
The staff was friendly and helpful

It worth the price specially if you will just need the room to sleep.

Nice position. Little bit smaller room, but enough for sleep. we were satisfied. we definitely recommend it and would love to go back there

great location, comfy bed

Location is excellent. The rooms were fabulous. Lots of extra touches.. chocolates at night on your pillows. Dressing gowns. Hairdryer. Staff were so accommodating as our luggage was lost in transit!
Nothing Loved this boutique hotel.

Really nice place to stay. Good sized room for the area, comfy bed, and friendly staff. Conveniently located yet, considering the location, surprisingly quiet. Close to a lot of touristy areas, but just off the path enough to feel like you're in a "local" area.

Parisian style boutique with lots of traditional features and very helpful staff.

Very comfortable bed and bath facilities.
It was a bit loud with the street noise and other guest room noise.

lovely staff, excellent breakfast and great location

Really lovely modern hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Great restaurant. Lots of nice restaurants, bakeries and bars nearby too.
Not the easiest to get bulky luggage / pram in and out of the room or up and down in the lift or stairs!

The staff are all lovely and the rooms are clean and have everything you need.
Nothing

Stylish and comfortable, excellent location, wonderful staff
Nothing

Great location. Quiet and very close to some awesome areas. The breakfast was lovely with many selections, generous, and so delicious. The views from our windows were picturesque Paris! Filled with history and a few blocks away from the craziness of the Moulin Rouge streets. The personal note in the room was special. The Mirror / TV was great to have but not be seen, in the room. The elevators are so tiny / old, so be very careful about suitcase size at this hotel.
The front desk staff could have been more forthcoming with the region, recommendations, and suggestions. Our roof level room had many ceiling angles created a feeling of being socked in. Next time, I would take a balcony room for ceiling height. There are skylights but we could not figure out how to close the light off. We chose the 6th floor for the space which was great with an added sitting area. The elevator only reaches the 5th floor, so to reach the 6th, a spiral staircase must be taken from 5th floor to 6th. It is very steep and difficult to manage with large suitcases or with any sort of leg issues. Choose 5th floor or less. The climate control was finicky, a little drafty when we could get it going. The hotel is much smaller than expected but lovely.

The rooms the ambience the service
Nothing

Staff were fantastic

Beautiful boutique hotel in a fun location! The staff was very nice and upgraded us for our honeymoon. The room was very well decorated and we had a little view of opera.
Nothing. Prepare yourself for a small room but all Paris hotels are small.

It is our favorite hotel in Paris! And it never disappoints us. The location, friendly and attentive staff as well as cozy super clean rooms keep us coming back time after time ! Special thanks to Emma for creating a special atmosphere for my daughter‚Äôs birthday! Room upgrade, cake ordering ( it was absolutely delicious) and always stay in touch even before our arrival! Thanks to Olivia at the front desk for her friendly and thoughtful attention and service !
Highly recommended!
Nothing

The location is excellent. It's right in the heart of the best eating area and very vibrant. It's easy to walk everywhere from here. I loved all of the amenities in the bathroom and thoughtful touches like a chocolate on our pillow. Best of all are the staff. The guy that served our breakfast was smiling all the time and very friendly as were the staff at the front desk. The breakfast was exceptional. Insanely good pancakes!
The room was on the small side and we were at the back so it was a bit dark. We didn't expect anything larger though as this is normal for Paris!

Great aesthetic and very friendly staff. The location was also great with many bars and restaurants nearby.

Modern, trendy, clean
Modern, comftable

Reception staff friendly and helpful. Room was a bit on the small side but well decorated and furnished. There were some great shops and restaurants right near the hotel.
The street was pretty noisy, but then that‚Äôs Paris. Also, the Metro line ran right underneath the hotel.

Room was small but didn't really matter to use since most of our time was spent out exploring Paris. The hotel is in a great location close to Montmartre and transit options. The staff was very helpful and we really loved our stay here! Only thing I would be aware of is the room got a bit stuffy at night so we had to open the window which introduced some street noise.
Really not much at all, just no air conditioning which is common in Paris

It‚Äôs cute, cosy
A bit small

Wonderful interior design and small, but lovely balconies.
The music at the reception area clashes with the music from the restaurant which results in a rather annoying undistinguishable noise. At breakfast, you are welcomed with loud music that seems mostly to serve the restaurant staff and ruins the otherwise easy going atmosphere of the hotel.

The location of the hotel is amazing. Close to the Montmarte area and the area of St Georges which was lovely. There are so many great bars and restaurants around and a really cool feel to the place. We had a balcony with seats which was a really great addition to the room and meant we enjoyed spending time in the room as well as exploring Paris. The bed was really comfy and we could see the sacre couer from the balcony. The staff were really helpful giving us a late check out as well and always nice and welcoming. My boyfriend was running the marathon and the day before and of the event they left notes and treats for him which was a really lovely touch.
The size of the room isn't very big. However that is very typical of Paris and so once we realised that it wasn't an issue! The bathroom didn't have a window so it felt a little bit damp but it wasn't a massive problem as we weren't there for long.

We arrived in Paris for our honeymoon and received the warmest welcome from the reception staff. We were lucky enough to get upgraded which was a wonderful surprise! The decor and design of the hotel is stunning, they really have finished it to a beautiful standard. The room was immaculate, as was the bathroom. We really appreciated the extra touches - soft fluffy towels and robes, slippers, high end toiletries, Nespresso machine, huge comfortable bed with crisp white sheets. Perfect in every way! The breakfast was brilliant, good choices and served in the lovely Frenchie restaurant. The location is fantastic too, we will definitely stay here again!

Everything! It really is our Parisian home! Such wonderful staff, nothing too much trouble! So friendly and helpful! gorgeous and chic room with the most comfortable bed. It was my birthday and they organised flowers. Excellent location. Just 10/10
Nothing

Great location and tasteful decor. A small room - but had everything we needed. Bathroom was very nice.
No faults

The rooms were comfy, clean and had everything we needed. The staff were friendly and the location was excellent.
We booked a family room via booking.com which was described as two rooms with a central area with seating and television. This suited us because our daughter wanted privacy but not separation. On check-in we were told there was no such room.

Cutest gem in Pigalle! 
Great location, the staff upgraded us for the night, which was sooooo appreciated. We had to change our stay because we had a death in the family and chose to go leave Paris sooner than expected to attend a funeral, so changed our booking from 4 nights to 1. The room was amazing. The windows, the bathroom, the decor - loved all of it.

Excellent reception staff, gorgeous quirky rooms, good location.
The hotel restaurant food was good, but lacked welcome & ambience for breakfast.

The hotel is good located for public transport but at night there is a lot of noise as there are some cafes in the neighborhood.

The location was great, 3 minutes from Pigalle tube and the surrounding area was full of great bars and spots to eat. 5 minute walk to Montmartre which we loved. The breakfast was fantastic and all of the staff could not have been more welcoming. We were given a balcony in our room which was such a bonus and they had made extra efforts for my Mum's 60th Birthday by leaving a happy birthday message on the mirror. Lovely touch walking into the room and hearing some jazz music. I had paid a ‚Ç¨70 for the fizz and fruit option and a lovely bottle of Champagne was already chilling in the room for our arrival.
The only thing I can feedback that I was disappointed about was the fruit platter that came alongside the fizz. It was 2 bananas, a mouldy pear and a soft apple which was all left untouched. I had envisioned and appetising fresh fruit platter sliced up to accompany the fizz (similar to how you serve the breakfast fruit). I wish it was only the bottle of fizz that was in the room as it almost cheapened it. Everything else was spot on and would come back to stay in future.

Every detail thought of. Wonderful staff. Very comfy beds
Tiny rooms

I love everything about this hotel, from the personalised welcome from the friendly staff to all the interactions with the people running the restaurant. Rooms are comfortable with nice jazz playing once you enter the room, beds are comfortable, room is dark when needed and the setting and design are on point. Couldn't recommend this hotel enough

Amazing hotel - very chic and typically French! The bed was comfortable and the pillows were really lovely, I loved the radio playing jazz when I walked in and the little balcony. The mini bar was really cute and well stocked and they had a travel plug free for use which is really thoughtful. The receptionist that welcomed us was warm and friendly and very helpful. Location is brilliant!
Noisy! If you are a light sleeper like I am make sure you bring something to drown out the noise - every step on the stairs and every door banging and people walking on the floor above me woke me up, the hotel is tir√¢tes opposite a bar so the people leaving at 2am also woke me up. The trains are quite loud too. But I would stay here again - just with earplugs.

Location, Rooms & Service

Pretty much everything
The noise from the street

Great location. Well designed, thoughtful layout. Staff were very friendly and great.
Nothing.

Rooms were small, our room was courtyard view, and there really wasn‚Äôt any view and it was a little bit on the darker side. Overall great charm at this hotel.

Comfortable rooms, great toiletries and weekend breakfast was great

Friendly staff, central location. Fantastic boutique hotel.
Nothing.

Location, design, staff, very clean 
Great bed, beautiful terrace and view. Loved the room and the area
Only if need to find something negative, the insulation isn‚Äôt that great so could hear a lot of noise in corridor from other guests but it can easily just be loud guests who weren‚Äôt considerate enough when used public areas

What a fantastic hotel!!! My husband and I had an exceptional stay at Grand Pigalle: Amazing, bright + romantic room ( suite sous les toits) with wonderful views of the Sacr√©-Coeur and surrounding area, beautiful design, spacious bathroom, all very clean, super comfy bed AND: the staff at this hotel is absolutely fabulous and went above and beyond to make these 5 days in Paris a truly wonderful and memorable experience. Great location as well! Thank you so much, team of Grand Pigalle!!
Nothing, it was perfect.

Lovely staff, everything about this hotel was great

The hotel is absolutely beautiful and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was gorgeous, so much that we did not want to leave. It was spacious despite what some of the reviews said..had gorgeous window balconies overlooking the streets, a wonderful fragrance as you entered, plush carpets, music playing, comfy slippers and robes and a welcome note. Cleanliness was exceptional. The bed was one of the comfiest I have slept in and the sheets felt luxurious. And the bathroom...again well decorated and exceptionally clean. I thoroughly enjoyed having a bath although it could do with a non slip mat due to the curve.
Only small things...a non slip mat for the bath and perhaps a second chair at the table.

We really enjoyed our stay at the grand pigalle, the rooms were so well designed and the interior is just beautiful, looks exactly like the photos. The staff were attentive and friendly. The view from our balcony made our trip to Paris.

The staff were so friendly and welcoming, putting in all extra touches for me and my grandma to make this a special trip
The only thing I‚Äôd say is it can be a bit noisy at night. However, that is what you get for being in a prime location so it‚Äôs not really an issue

brilliant location, friendly staff and all round amazing trip
There wasn‚Äôt anything bad to say at all

clean 
great location 
safe 
great staff
a little noisy

style, clean, cozy
windows don‚Äôt close fully, so a little loud at night

The staff, the room, it was just a lovely hotel

We spent the last night of our honeymoon here - they very kindly upgraded our room! The location in Paris was great, very close to Moulin Rouge and lots of restaurants. Bed was very comfortable, great in room bar and coffee selections! Spacious room as well, especially for Paris.
We would have liked if the TV had a Netflix option. Other than that everything was great.

A beautiful and quirky hotel in the heart of the Moulin Rouge district, with Montmartre on your doorstep and the loveliest cafes and shops around. The location is perfect and the interior of the rooms is beautiful and very Paris-like.

We loved our stay at Grand Pigalle! The room had so many lovely touches (e.g. French jazz playing on the stereo, bottled cocktails in the mini bar, plug adaptors, etc), was beautifully decorated and very clean and modern. The bed was big and very comfy, as were the towels. The bathroom had everything we could possibly need (hairdryer, face cloths, lovely shower products) and was also beautifully tiled. The staff were lovely and very responsive to anything we needed at any hour. The location was also brilliant - on a lovely street and very easy to get around, close to Gard du Nord & Pigalle metro.
The room was lovely but very cosy; it wasn't really big enough for 2 large suitcases and we were often stepping over them - but we spent most of the time outside of the hotel anyway so this didn't really matter, especially for just a few days. In future we would definitely stay at Grand Pigalle again, but book a larger room.

Nice decor
The noisiest hotel I‚Äôve ever stayed in! We stayed for three nights and had to wear noise cancelling headphones just to get any sleep (the earplugs they leave for you in the room aren‚Äôt good enough). When we complained they said it‚Äôs just the area and there‚Äôs nothing they can do about it. But it wasn‚Äôt just the outside noise - you can hear EVERYTHING that goes on in the rooms either side of you. Also, we booked two rooms and on arrival only one of the rooms was upgraded. This meant we were left to decide with our friends who was getting the better room (for the same price!) Bit of an awkward start to the holiday. The hotel‚Äôs response was ‚Äòsurely one upgrade is better than nothing‚Äô. Yes - unless you‚Äôre the couple in the smaller room. Wouldn‚Äôt stay again.

1. Very comfortable bed and pillows, 
2. Very clean room (thank you to housekeeping who changed towels twice a day),
3. Varied and quality room service options from the restaurant downstairs, very well-stocked mini-bar if you wanted to use it, free water in the room 
4. Cool aesthetic design, large windows which open wide, 
5. Great location in terms of restaurants/metro/landmarks/walking,
6. Our 6th time in Paris and the room compares favourably in size to other hotels, 
7. Smooth check-in and check-out process,
8. Some staff were very friendly and helpful (thank you to Adele and the man who tried to resolve the issue with the safe as well as their colleague who checked us out at 6AM). 
9. Used the laundry service which was very quick 
10. Good selection of toiletries and hairdryer 
11. Towels were changed twice a day which was very helpful 
12. We had reservations elsewhere so didn‚Äôt use the restaurant but people we spoke to said they enjoyed it and it was great quality, it had a nice vibe
A few things to consider when booking but not all bad: 
1. The noise from the bars on the street (it didn‚Äôt bother me too much as I live in a city centre so am used to it but even I found my sleep disrupted, so some people may be put off). 
2. I would not recommend a room with the shower/wet room as it is inexplicably designed. We had to cross the shower to get to the toilet but the wet room takes a long time to drain. Shelves are awkwardly placed. However, the bathroom design looks great and is actually very spacious but is not practical. 
3. No coffee maker or kettle. Room service is very quick and good quality so not a problem for many people but I prefer to make a coffee or tea sometimes without needing to interact with anyone. 
4. Bed was super comfy but seemed slightly small, more like a double than a queen or king 
5. Small elevator might not be ideal for people with limited mobility but it‚Äôs typical of these old Parisian buildings 
6. We had an issue with the safe not working which I had to take the initiative to resolve myself by purchasing new batteries, which was not ideal but understandable as it was a bank holiday and the technician was not available immediately. The staff were very attentive especially Adele and her colleague who quickly tried to resolve it and were very apologetic as they would have moved us had the hotel not been fully booked. But something to bear in mind for future that changing the batteries will fix it!

Nice big room, really nice bed + sheets. Big bathroom, though for some reason the tub under the shower is only just wide enough to stand in. Staff were friendly, breakfast was simple but tasty.

Good location, bed was comfy.
Room was extremely small, not a lot of storage or space, neighborhood is pretty noisy, which would be fine except you can hear everything in the hall of the hotel, people in the room next door, the pipes in the walls every time someone flushed a toilet. 
While the staff was very friendly and helpful when prompted, it wasn‚Äôt a very service oriented hotel.

Het is een leuk hotel, ziet er leuk uit, locatie lijkt op het eerste oog wat minder in Pigalle maar de straat waar het hotel ligt is leuk, leuke eettentjes en winkeltjes. Richting Montmartre/Sacrecoeur is 10 min lopen.
Wij hadden een kamer aan de achterkant op de 2e verdieping die erg warm was, later bleken wij niet de enigen te zijn die hier last van hadden, met het raam open was er een giga herrie vanbuitenaf van een airco unit oid. Dat zou blijkbaar van de achergelegen bakkerij afkomstig zijn. Herrie was zodanig hard dat we eerste nacht niet hebben kunnen slapen. Na klacht kregen we een nieuwe kamer op 5e verdieping, geluid was er nog steeds maar wel veel minder hard waardoor we wel konden slapen. Personeel heeft wel haar best gedaan maar was niet heel proactief.

Nothing really shocking that we did not like.
If I really need to highlight something, it is related to the fact that our room (4th floor) was attached to other 2 rooms separated by doors that must be locked on both sides of the rooms. This is very useful when you are more than two people as you can communicate and share the rooms, but could be annoying if you don‚Äôt know your neighbours and if they are noisy.

We loved the location! Easy to walk to places and there was great restaurants in every location. Staff was wonderful and pleasant. The room was small but cozy and comfortable for two.

There is no fridge in the room.
The lift is very very very small - you can go through the stairs, but they are not very well lit and a little deep.

This is a small hotel but a bit of a gem. Location, great staff, very nice well-appointed rooms, interconnecting for family, price. All terrific. Our rooms were small but the cleanliness and the fixtures and fittings were excellent and the rooms on higher floors are bigger. The building has a lot of old character too and has been very carefully and faithfully restored. The staff were all excellent and incredibly helpful without exception.
The hotel is undergoing a refurbishment so the breakfast area was not quite completed. However with the imminent completion of the eating area, this becomes irrelevant. The staircases have been terrifically restored but are quite narrow and probably would not suit anyone with mobility or balance issues. The elevator is very small and used for transporting baggage only so the staircase is the mode of access to the floors above where the rooms are located.

Location. In addition, very quiet.
The elevator is too small but it works.

Found a piece dust on floor in the room but staffs top. Spa is a bit disappointed as small and not hot enough, could be better.

Very central to walk everywhere

A little expensive for the size of room but that‚Äôs Paris! Made up by the overall experience.

Very easy location for both walking and for getting the metro.

The staff were all very warm and friendly.
The property is very clean and newly renovated.

This little gem of a hotel has a fantastic location just a few feet off of Blvd Haussmann, convenient to Metro & buses, restaurants, pastry shops and shopping, and just a few minutes walk to Paris Opera House and Galeries Lafayette. Rooms are quite small, but very attractively furnished and extremely clean. Front desk staff were all welcoming, friendly and helpful.
Our room was quite small, but for our short stay, that was perfectly fine. We would not recommend for a long stay or if you just feel the need for lots of space. The elevator was so tiny, it could not accommodate guests plus luggage, but front desk staff were happy to immediately bring our bags to our room.

Great location, good size rooms all with ensuite, clean, comfortable beds.
Not a big issue but it has the smallest lift I have ever seen!

Good location - 7 minutes from the Gallery Lafayette. 
A clean room but small room - we took two rooms with a connecting door. 
Good staff, helped us with everything we needed. 
The only drawback of the hotel - a small elevator that fits only one person! They brought up our luggage one by one. And my family came up separately each time. The elevator is not suitable for big and fat people, keep that in
A very very small elevator is only suitable for one person with a trolley. Consider not suitable for big and fat people :(

The location was amazing. Walkable to a lot of Paris attractions and department stores (Lafayette and Printemps) Very close to Metro stations (to line M8 and M9) if you needed to go somewhere farther. The rooms were very nice, modern, and clean. Staff was very helpful in making reservations at restaurants and clear in communication. WiFi and hair dryer worked well.
The hotel itself was going under some construction while we were there (August 2023), so there was no "sleeping in" as there was construction going on in the morning (around 9am). Our room's toilet paper holder fell off the wall once, and there was a shelf in the bathroom that looked like it was about to fall off the wall -- almost made me feel like the construction was rushed for our room.
The elevator/lift was very small (even for Europe), but still functioned great.
No fridges in rooms, but front desk allowed us to use their refrigerator/freezer.

Very nice little hotel - we travelled as a family of four, had two room with a connection door, which felt it was one appartment. Hotel personal was extraordinary friendly. The breakfast was nice as well.

Lovely hotel on quiet side street but close to many shops and walking distance from Opera. Rooms were modern, well appointed and with double fire doors helping to soundproof from corridor/stairs. The breakfast looked lovely but sadly our schedule didn't allow breakfast. Staff very friendly and helpful. Well furnished and laid out extremely well to maximise the space. So actually no real complaints beyond the lift size. USB ports by bed both sides and full length mirror and a very powerful shower. And a decent Hairdryer not a bathroom hold-in type seen in a lot of hotels. Good array of teas coffees and chocolate almonds with complimentary toiletries in bathroom plus a decent TV should you wish to watch it.
Our room was 5th floor and the lift is miniscule. Not suitable for disabled guests if staying higher up building. Shame as lovely place. Definitely keeps you fit. Small room but as expected from Paris standards so all good.

Went above and beyond for us, setting up our room for our first day of our honeymoon! Great balcony outside and super comfy. Location is great, by the Opera and a lot of shopping/good food
Elevator that fits 1.5 people. Maybe 1. Maybe 2 if your very tiny. My husband and I could both fit if we jenga our bodies in. The room was also so so small there was barely any room for our luggage, had to maneuver each time we wanted out the door

location near laffayat 5 - 10 min walk

Very convenient, comfortable and very nice staff.

The hotel is expensive, however, this is the price you pay for location and quality in Paris. The lift was very small (and we knew this from the reviews prior to coming) - I wasn't expecting it to be that small but it was incredibly entertaining every time we used the lift. Overall these things I 'liked least' did not impact our stay.

The inside court window had no noise and allowed us to open it at night for fresh air (because the air conditioning did not work). Great water pressure. Also an elevator although very small.
There are supposed to be essential oil pods and there weren't. There was no air conditioning even though it was advertised. The noise isolation within the hotel despite it being advertised was lacking. The kettle was dirty as well as it's filter (we put the filter on the side for the cleaner to see it but they threw away the filter and left the kettle dirty it was brown at the bottom). When they are cleaning the rooms (the hallways are narrow) and there are just bags of towels and garbage. The night time receptionist made no effort whatsoever (we requested the essential oils specifically he could not find them because the cleaning ladies kept stock of them and, there was no air conditioning) as he informed us and there was nothing done about it nor were we compensated.

The staff was very friendly and helpful with getting our luggage up to our rooms. The location was really nice, easy to get to via taxi and located close to the metro. The breakfast was exactly what you might expect at a hotel, it did the trick. Also, there were lots of bars and restaurants close by, so we found the neighborhood lively and fun.
Like most places in Paris the hotel was tiny, so that can't really be helped. However, we had selected a 
"2 bedroom apartment", and when we arrived we found out that meant two tiny rooms with a conjoining door. Also, when we asked for help bringing down our suitcases at check-out the staff said to just load the luggage in the elevator and they'd pick it up below. However, the elevator was so small my grandma's luggage couldn't fit. So my 80 year old grandpa and I had to take two suitcases down 4 flights of stairs. Not ideal if you're elderly, but if you're young and don't mind a small space, it isn't a bad hotel at all!

The bed was super comfy and large! and it was very central! In walking distance of most attractions. Staff were very friendly.
nothing

Nice hotel, close to metro, bus and centre. 
Breakfast is good, Different choices to choose from. Personal is very friendly and helpful. It was a good place.
Nothing really in particular. Just that the room and the lift are super small. The room is nice but just tight to move around. If you are most of the time outside its fine. 
One more thing: We arrived around 13.30-14h. The check-in is at 15h so we had to wait. I had the feeling you could enter your room earlier if you pay.

Staff very courteous and helpful. Very willing to accommodate. The room were very clean. And it was pretty quiet. Location is great, right by the Hausner Blvd.

Well located, many sites nearby within walking distance. Very nice and helpful staff. Quiet and clean rooms. Parking nearby.

Firstly, the staff (especially Sofia), were extremely friendly and helpful in every way. They talked us through the check in/out process and it was very smooth. The room was lovely, very clean and we had a lovely skylight which brought in lots of natural light. We both said it was one of the best sleeps we had in a long time. The bed and pillows were very comfy and we even tried looking at the brand to see if we could buy some of the pillows for our own house! 
The hotel is a 2 minute walk to the Metro station which can take you all over the city which was fantastic, but also the location allows you to walk and explore the beautiful city, with most places being within 10-30 minutes walking distance.
So yes, the lift is extremely small and does not fit more than one person at a time, or maybe 2 small children...so wouldn't be suitable for you if you are claustrophobic. But we actually found it very quirky and funny and it gave us a good laugh at the same time. That would be the only negative.

Lovely boutique hotel. Very clean, friendly helpful staff. Lovely hot and cold breakfast.

I cannot fathom how this is a 4 star. The room was tiny, so small that there are no bedside tables nor even a chair to sit on. The bathroom was so small that my knees touched the wall when using the toilet (apologies) and the shower, it was easier to dry yourself and dress in the shower than in the space. The TV reception was poor and only has a few French channels. The lobby of the hotel was basically a few tiny sofas infront of the checkin desk. The lift was only about 40cm wide so more like an upright coffin. if anyone is not petite or has any claustrophobia then you couldn‚Äôt come here. we had to go up and down the lift separately as a family. the bags had to travel separately. and the whole week we were here the road was being dug up so there were diggers and noise the whole day. a total nightmare. housekeeping didn‚Äôt turn up one day. I booked this hotel for my mother who specializes in French literature. She was delighted by the concept and appreciated hotel's collection of Marcel Proust's eouvres. Lovely staff great breakfast

wonderful!!

The location is exceptional and the view from the rooftop is absolutely wonderful. The interior of the hotel is great, well designed rooms and really cosy reception and restaurant areas. Breakfast buffet is also great with lots of hot and cold choices including honeycomb and a selection of cheeses. The staff were very friendly and helpful too.
The room was super tiny and there was too much furniture making it feel even smaller (although the bed was absolutely huge and very comfortable). 
The rooftop views were incredible but the rooftop bar is closed for the winter so the only way to enjoy it was to bring your own drink and sit in the cold. A few gas heaters would solve the problem as it's a shame to lose such a great feature of the hotel for the whole winter season.

full_description:
L'h√¥tel Edouard 7 Op√©ra vous accueille dans le centre de Paris, √† 3 minutes √† pied de l'op√©ra Garnier, √† 400 m√®tres de la place Vend√¥me et √† 500 m√®tres des Galeries Lafayette.

Toutes les chambres et les suites du Edouard 7 disposent de la climatisation et d'une connexion Wi-Fi haut d√©bit gratuite. Certaines poss√®dent un balcon priv√© ou offrent une vue sur l'avenue de l'Op√©ra. Chaque logement comporte une salle de bains privative pourvue d'une baignoire ou d'une douche, de peignoirs et d'articles de toilette gratuits.

Un petit-d√©jeuner buffet am√©ricain est servi tous les jours moyennant des frais suppl√©mentaires. L'h√¥tel comprend aussi un bar proposant des cocktails qui sauront satisfaire tous les go√ªts. Le restaurant "La Cuisine de l'E7" sert une cuisine locale avec des menus bio et de saison.

L'√©tablissement poss√®de un espace d'affaires ainsi qu'une r√©ception ouverte 24h/24 assurant des services de change et de bagagerie. Une salle de sport et des services de concierge/d'√©tage sont aussi mis √† votre disposition. Un parking public est disponible √† proximit√©.

L'h√¥tel se situe √† 5 minutes √† pied de la place Vend√¥me et de boutiques de luxe. Accessible √† 200 m√®tres, la station de m√©tro Op√©ra dessert des sites touristiques comme le Louvre ou le jardin des Tuileries. Vous pourrez prendre la navette Roissybus place de l'Op√©ra pour rejoindre l'a√©roport international de Paris-Charles-de-Gaulle.

Comfort of the room and location

Very well located. The staff was courteous and always willing to help. The room was exactly as advertised and the location allowed for nearby restaurants and close to a major subway station making crossing the city quite easy.
The room could have more light and outlets. The bathroom has sufficient outlets but to charge multiple cellphones and backup batteries at night we felt a bit cramped. next to yours. Even when people plug in their phone in the wall outlet. Not to mention voices and shouting. Rooms are tiny.

Location of the hotel was awesome. It was in the Opera area and close walk to everything or 5-10 min taxi ride.
Room was comfortable and spacious and was kept clean at all the times.
I had the used the Breakfast on my Check-out date, which was good. Eggs, omelettes, baguettes, cheese etc.
I think because of the age of the building and regulations, lift was not too big and there was only one in the hotel. 
Sometimes we had to wait couple minutes. Depending on the floor of your room, it may be seen as a disadvantage.
I do not complain about it though.

The staff were our favorite part. Everyone was pleasant and Helene the front desk manager and the concierge were terrific. I have a CPAP and was not able to get the distilled water needed for it our entire time in Amsterdam. The staff went out of their way to get me some which made my sleep much better. They also helped us get our bearing in the city. The room was cozy and clean and the bed was very comfortable. It terrace was also very nice.
The neighborhood the hotel was in is very nice and clean, and a few minutes walk to multiple metro stations. But coffee shops and stores in the area open very late if you're wanting to get up early to see the city. It is not near the more bustling social centers in the city but it does not take long to get their by the metro. The room was nice but it was always very warm no matter what we did. We had to sleep with the window open to stay cool. The shower has a weird design and every time I showered the bathroom floor was filled with standing water no matter what I tried.

I would like to take a moment to express our gratitude for the wonderful stay we recently had at hotel Edouard 7 in Paris. From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by the charming atmosphere and the excellent location‚Äîso close to everything we wanted to see and do in the city.
Most importantly, we cannot say enough about the incredibly friendly and attentive staff. Polina, Laurent, and the entire breakfast team went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They truly made our stay special with their warm hospitality and eagerness to help with anything we needed.

We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a delightful and comfortable experience in Paris. We can't wait to return on our next visit!

The service from your staff was impeccable. #1- FIRST the BEST thing about the hotel was RISAL. Every time he saw me, he bent over backwards to offer me the fastest, most excellent and attentive service. One of these occasions was crucial to my enjoyment in Paris. I had tickets for the Philharmonie for 20:00 on Thursday I had reserved 4 months in advance. Because of traffic delays, I had get a taxi. It was 19:00, and I could not get a good one fast! Uber estimated arrival at the hotel at 19.30. RISAL literally ran to the street and got me a taxi and I was able to arrive the concert BEFORE the beginning of the concert! I was very grateful and I offered him my thanks with a very generous pourboire on the last day! #2- The front desk was always attentive, especially those employees who worked at night. #3- The bar employees knew exactly what I wanted to drink when I sat there. One young man, even order the correct Bacardi rum for me so I would have it the next night. #4- I never used the dining room or ate breakfast there, so I cannot provide a review for them. #5- The front desk always provided me with extra coffee packages when it ran out - since I always drank coffee at night. #6- The room was always quiet even on those nights I liked opening the windows. I enjoyed being able to stay out late at night and being able to come in by using the bell. #7- I was provided with a larger luggage holder by the front desk. #8- the Location was phenomenally convenient.
My 7th floor room was unacceptable. #1- The light in the room was so poor that I could NOT see inside the "closet" space against the wall. I was forced to redirect the bed lights towards the wall to see what I had put there. #2- The balcony was not a balcony at all, if I would gotten onto it, I could have fallen to my death. I felt that either the listing for that room was incorrect or you expected me to accept a "balcony" which was really a perch for birds to land. #3- The bathroom did not have handles in the bathtub to hold on to. I am older than most of your guests and I slipped and fell in the bathtub and it took me 20 minutes to lift myself out of it because I could not hold onto something. You really should consider replacing your narrow, slippery and antiquated bathtubs with showers. That would upgrade the quality of your hotel considerably. #4- The cost for this room was not commensurate with the quality I expected. I realized that my room was probably used as servants room in bygone years. That was disappointing, to say the least. I might stay again next year if these important things are resolved to my satisfaction.

We were told that it would be available in ten minutes and were directed to the bar where we spent 20 euros for a couple of soft drinks - if we were to go back we would just pop out to one of the local cafes before using the hotel bar which is a windowless affair (from my memory) just off reception. Our room once available was fine although the aircon didn't appear to be working. However, the temperature was cool enough in early April so it didn't worry us. We didn't book breakfast as it was much cheaper to eat locally than pay the b&b rate.

I enjoyed my stay at the Edouard 7 mainly due to the staff's efforts. I was impressed by how courteous and professional they are and by how much pride they take in ensuring that we had a comfortable stay and in the reputation of the hotel.

I arrived to a bow on my door, there was a turn down service in which the first night they left me a chocolate torte for my birthday (which was delicious and so unexpected!) The beds were really comfortable, the views were amazing and the small window balcony was just the best way to experience our first trip to Paris. A special mention to Laurent who was a fantastic host and a credit to the hotel. He made personal reservations for us at a restaurant and even walked us part of the way there! I could genuinely not have had a better experience, thank you so much! highly recommend!
