We requested a room for three people and what we got was NOTHING like we saw on Booking! We simply received a double room with King bed and a small portable cot that was jammed in between the bed and window for the third person. It was beyond tight and you couldn‚Äôt move around the bed to open the drapes (we had to climb on the bed to reach them every morning). The pictures and description should have been more accurate and we paid considerably more for this room. I spoke with the hotel manager and he told me that I should have specifically asked for the room that I saw on Booking directly with them prior to our visit. There was nothing they could do to because the hotel was full, so we kept the room but felt like we really overpaid for it and had I known, we would have stayed somewhere else. Also, the hotel is older than it appears in the pictures, we had old carpeting with large stains all over which just gave it an unclean feeling. Again, for the room rate, we felt like we overpaid and there are a lot of options in Paris.

full_description:
L'Hotel Paris Op√©ra, Affiliated by Meli√° occupe un b√¢timent haussmannien du XVIIIe si√®cle, juste en face de la station de m√©tro Grand Boulevards. Situ√© √† 10 minutes √† pied du grand magasin Galeries Lafayette, l‚Äô√©tablissement comprend une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite dans l‚Äôensemble de ses locaux ainsi que des h√©bergements avec une t√©l√©vision √† √©cran LCD.

Les chambres et les suites de l'Hotel Paris Op√©ra Affiliated by Meli√° sont toutes √©quip√©es d'un minibar, d'un coffre-fort priv√© et d'une t√©l√©vision connect√©e √† √©cran plat.

Vous aurez la possibilit√© de savourer un petit-d√©jeuner buffet parisien compos√© de produits frais locaux ainsi que de sp√©cialit√©s fran√ßaises et espagnoles.

Vous s√©journerez √† 26 km de l‚Äôa√©roport de Paris-Charles-de-Gaulle. Sur demande, vous profiterez d‚Äôune navette a√©roport. La station de m√©tro la plus proche vous permettra de rejoindre directement la place de la Concorde et vous trouverez l‚Äôop√©ra Garnier √† 10 minutes √† pied.

Occupant un immeuble haussmannien en plein c≈ìur du quartier de Saint-Germain-des-Pr√©s, √† seulement 10 minutes √† pied du Louvre, le boutique h√¥tel 5 √©toiles Hotel Montalembert propose des chambres dot√©es de la climatisation, ainsi qu'un bar-restaurant.

Les chambres √©l√©gantes de l'Hotel Montalembert affichent des ≈ìuvres d'art originales sur les murs. Elles disposent toutes d'une t√©l√©vision par satellite √† √©cran plat. Leur salle de bains moderne est munie d'articles de toilette gratuits.

Chaque jour, le petit-d√©jeuner vous sera servi dans la salle pr√©vue √† cet effet ou en chambre, sur demande. Le restaurant sur place pr√©pare une cuisine gastronomique innovante. Vous pourrez prendre vos repas ou des boissons sur la terrasse, lorsque le temps le permet.

L'Hotel Montalembert poss√®de une r√©ception ouverte 24h/24 assurant un service de concierge. Une connexion Wi-Fi est √©galement accessible gratuitement dans l'ensemble des locaux de cet √©tablissement non-fumeurs.

La station de m√©tro Rue du Bac, permettant l'acc√®s direct √† Montmartre, est accessible √† 220 m√®tres. Enfin, vous pourrez rejoindre √† pied le jardin du Luxembourg en 15 minutes, le mus√©e d'Orsay en 7 minutes et le centre commercial Le Bon March√© en 10 minutes.

Quiet, convenient location. Well trained staff, and comfortable and quiet room. Just the right size hotel, thoughtfully renovated within an old building.

Breakfast was excellent. Good choice
Staff extremely helpful and so friendly.

The location was central to many sites we wanted to visit. Our television did not work the first day and it was replaced after the staff was notified on the second day. The internet was slow, only 2 people could fit in the elevators, 1 person if there was luggage, and while the hotel was spotlessly clean, the entry way was dated. Our suite was beautiful and the view from the 7th floor was breathtaking. The bedding was of great quality and the bed was the best we had as we traveled across Europe. The house keeping staff were excellent at their craft, as were the front desk staff. There was an African American gentleman whonwent above and beyind to share information about restaurants and their menu and the manager called several restaurants to determine their menu. We were very pleased with our stay.
At the price point we paid, everything in the room should have worked with precision.l prior to our arrival. The towel warmer was not functional and television did not work until it was replaced the following day. The carpet was shedding in the bedroom area. Despite our compromises, we were charged for the use of the mini bar even though we were not told there was a charge for it's use.

The location, rooms and staff were all amazing. Great service and everyone made us feel right at home during our stay.

Great location, lovely neighbourhood with chic shops & places to eat. We were able to easily walk to the Louvre & the Tuileries, got a Seine boat trip from the Pont Neuf. Very central.
We knew before booking that the restaurant does not offer dinner but we were a bit disappointed that the bar was closed at 10 pm on a Saturday. We were offered drinks on room service.

The hotel has a cosy neighbourhood feel. We always stay on the Rive Gauche and the Montalembert is our first choice.
The service at the restaurant/bar is a bit hit and miss. Like in a lot of places in France the coffee is awful and should be avoided. For coffee aficionados the little Noir chain has a place around the corner.

Location great
Room fine

The Montalembert is brilliantly located to explore attraction and shops on the rive gauche as well as museums on the other side. Staff is very helpful with parking, bags, shopping, restaurant suggestions and bookings. The hotel is charming with rooms on the small side (but it‚Äôs Paris after all;-) and well equipped. We had a lovely view over the roofs of Paris to the garden courtyard of SciencePo which was a treat (a converted cloister). The chimes of the next door church - at 9:00am very civilised - were magical.
Breakfast is a bit so so and better coffee from a proper machine would be a huge improvement.

It's a well-wrought hotel with effortless left bank style. The staff is warm, welcoming and very helpful. The hotel I normally stay at was fully booked, so I tried Hotel Montalembert for a change and felt it was money well-spent.
The only thing I'm not keen on is its location. The location is very convenient for sight-seeing (Musee d'Orsay, Musee Rodin, Louvre etc), if one is unfamiliar with Paris, and visiting the sights high on one's agenda. There is also a grocery store right across from the hotel. While it does offer this level of convenience, this location (from my pov) is sterile and less residential than what I personally prefer. it lacks the charm and energy of the Saint Germain I know.

the staff was incredible! Marie at the front desk was the best! the balcony was so a feature for us

That night we were woken by the maid at 9.30 pm who entered , turning all lights on to put fresh towels in the room. She said it was our fault as we had not placed the do not disturb sign out. 
The breakfast staff have no idea about hand hygiene. No tongs are used. They clean tables then touch each piece of baguette or pastry placed in your breakfast basket 
Feeling very hot at night , we could not believe that the bed is made up with a polyester quilt in a 5 star hotel

full_description:
Id√©alement situ√© dans le centre de Paris, le Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel propose des h√©bergements climatis√©s, une salle de sport, une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite et une terrasse. Cet h√¥tel 5 √©toiles comporte un bar. Vous profiterez √©galement d‚Äôun centre d‚Äôaffaires ainsi que de services d‚Äô√©tage et de change.

Les chambres de l‚Äôh√¥tel comportent un bureau, une t√©l√©vision √† √©cran plat et une salle de bains privative. Les serviettes de toilette et le linge de lit sont fournis. Chaque h√©bergement est √©quip√© d'un coffre-fort. Certains sont √©quip√©s d'un balcon et d'autres offrent une vue sur la ville. Toutes les chambres sont munies d‚Äôune armoire.

Un petit-d√©jeuner buffet, continental ou am√©ricain est propos√© chaque matin. Le Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel poss√®de un restaurant servant une cuisine m√©diterran√©enne. Des plats v√©g√©tariens, v√©g√©taliens et sans gluten sont √©galement pr√©par√©s sur demande.

Le personnel de la r√©ception ouverte 24h/24 parle allemand, anglais, arabe et espagnol.

L'arc de Triomphe se trouve √† 700 m√®tres, tandis que le Palais des Congr√®s de Paris vous attend √† 1,7 km de l‚Äô√©tablissement. L‚Äôa√©roport de Paris-Orly est situ√© √† 23 km.

The location was great. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very helpful and pleasant . The hotel accommodated an early check-in that was very beneficial after our long flight from Miami
When we returned from dinner the first night, our bathroom and front area of room were flooded. The smell was terrible, and we could not access our belongings. Location is great - 300 meters from the Arc of Triumph and walking distance to two Metro station and RER station, which makes it very convenient to travel to different part of Paris. Room is big and the bed is very comfortable. The staff are very friendly and they refill the supplements very frequently - water, tower, hotel slippers and etc. During my stay, I never worry about being lack of these. The breakfast is also good - wide variety and good quality.
The only setback for this hotel is its elevator - the hotel has more than 7 floors and there are only two elevators for both staff and guest, the pain part is that one out of two is under decoration/maintainance so there's only one elevator available for both guest and staff. Consequently, during some peak traffic time like breakfast and checkout, we have to wait long time to get into the elevator since sometimes it's full. Although it's a bit not acceptable but I would say this is understandable, the hotel locates in center Paris and the buildings here have limited allowance to do reconstruction/redecoration.

Great location great staff great property...elevator was under maintenance so a bit of an inconvenient especially until the 2nd one is renovated but apart from that highly recommended...

The room was small, tired looking, with grubby net curtains, chipped furniture and soiled areas of carpet - I paid ¬£2.2k for 3 nights.......high price for low standards and service
I had emailed the hotel ahead of my arrival as we were there as a 50th birthday present for my husband - I asked in my email if there was anything the hotel could do to acknowldge the special ocassion and they sent me a price list of items I could order - I was in the 'best' room in the hotel, spending alot of money and not even a welcome complimentary drink
As my previous point states we were there for a birthday gift for my husband - the staff member who booked us in did not think to ask who had paid for the trip and would it be ok to disclose prices, and automatically assumed my husband had and told him what I was paying for his birthday present.....this then turned into an uncomfortable exchange between my hsuband and I on how much I'd spent on a hotel for 3 nights!

We stayed at this hotel when it first opened. It was amazing, clean, comfortable and well trained professional staff. However, everything went downhill in recent years. This time, when we entered the lobby of the hotel, it already felt dated, only one lift is working, corridor is dark, carpet looks faded and the overall place felt kooky and shabby, especially in the corridors leading to our rooms. When we entered our hotel room, we saw fingerprints and the minibar fridge. The room has an extremely pungeant smell to it as well as it being unclean (after removing the bottles of drinks in the fridge, we found the bottom of the fridge is sticky and with many stains.When we first came to Renaissance many years ago, the amenities for theirs guests were a luxury brand , yet the soaps/shampoos that were now provided are unknown brands. the daily clean was careless, the sink has visible stain but has not been wiped off‚Ä¶. The room interior like everywhere else in the hotel is dated, worn out‚Ä¶ this is all relative to 5-star-hotel standard, what we are experiencing is barely 4 star. Not worth the room rates at all.

Location, service, attention, facilities, room cleanliness

Good location of the hotel. Clean rooms, good bed, excellent room facilities. Good breakfasts. The hotel has an underground garage.
The hotel had one elevator on 9 or 10 floors. The waiting time for the elevator is 5-10 minutes. Most of the time the elevator is busy with staff problems, the staff carries beds, linen, clothes. The staff was terrible. All requests are processed very slowly. I got the impression that I was begging the staff for something: to bring coffee in a restaurant, to bring glasses for breakfast. This is not acceptable behavior of staff in any hotel, especially in a 5 * hotel

full_description:
Dot√© d'une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite et d'un bistro-restaurant, l'√©tablissement Pavillon Faubourg Saint-Germain & Spa vous propose des h√©bergements √† Paris, √† seulement 500 m√®tres de Saint-Germain-des-Pr√©s. Vous pourrez savourer, pr√®s de la chemin√©e en pierre du salon, une boisson ou un verre de vin command√©s au bar sur place.

D√©cor√©es dans des tons chauds, toutes les chambres du Pavillon Faubourg Saint-Germain & Spa sont √©quip√©es d'une t√©l√©vision √† √©cran plat et d'une bouilloire √©lectrique, ainsi que de chaussons et d'articles de toilette gratuits. Certaines chambres poss√®dent un coin salon.

Le petit-d√©jeuner est servi tous les matins moyennant des frais suppl√©mentaires. Vous pourrez le d√©guster dans le confort de votre chambre, sur demande aupr√®s de la r√©ception ouverte 24h/24.

Pavillon Faubourg Saint-Germain & Spa se tient √† 600 m√®tres du mus√©e d'Orsay et √† 700 m√®tres du mus√©e du Louvre. L'a√©roport de Paris-Orly, le plus proche, est quant √† lui distant de 14 km.

I took my grandmother to stay at Pavillon Faubourg Saint-Germain & Spa, as the hotel looked lovely and is conveniently located for someone who wish to stay close to the river and the main sites It was easy for my grandmother to walk to the many nearby restaurants and to the Louvre. The hotel was very pleasant. The staff was very friendly and to especially good care of my grandmother, we even had a dip in the hotel pool ! The room was comfortable, clean and tidy and the breakfast buffet was also very tasty. 

I will stay at this hotel again on my next trip to Paris.

Beautiful hotel and very nice comfortable room. perfect location. Restaurant was amazing too.

The staff was incredible and the hotel was dreamy! It was on a quiet but central street and it was the most picturesque decor. We went around Christmas time so it was quite magical and smelled of fresh pine in the lobby. The upgraded our room when we checked in and we had the most amazing suite!! It was definitely larger than our US sized master bedroom and had two bathrooms!! What a treat. 
Annette checked us in and she was amazing/so friendly. We were able to walk to some of the liveliest locations in Saint Germain but if we didn't want to do that we typically hopped on the e-bikes right out front and rode them around the city-which I highly recommend. 
The bar and cocktails were delicious and it was quite the vibe. Loved hanging out there.
The spa was also incredible: only and very minor complaint was that we were hoping the pool was more of jacuzzi temperature but non-issue-just preference. Thank you for a dream vacation!

nothing, it was perfect

I hate to mention this but our bathroom shower was tricky to regulate and screen leaked over floor if you let shower head flow touch glass ,felt this rooms bathroom needs attention; secondly, through no fault of the hotel ,workmen were repairing the pavement outside our room which disturbed our peace, but just one of those things...

Beautifully decorated stylish hotel with lovely rooms and a great location.
No service in the daytime if you want to sit in the bar/lounge area for drinks and very limited room service menu.

The property was clean, and a great location. The staff were attentive and helpful.
nothing

Beautiful spacious, elegant, modern suite. Very nice indeed. Staff excellent

location

the service was great. staff very friendly and helpful

awesome

service was exceptional

The Hotel has been perfectly renovated, its interior and exterior are beautiful. Breakfast was small but all the food on offer was delicious.
We were there for sightseeing, a trip to Disney and shopping. The hotel is a about a half hr walk away from the train station and even the first stop for the hop on hop off bus.

Food in restaurant was fantastic

beautiful property, top location, very nice staff
some staff need a bit more experience

We loved staying at Pavillon Faubourg Saint-Germain in Paris.
Excellent staff and hotel. We look forward to staying there again, next time we visit.

Clean room ,excellent location

Situated in the 7th district, the hotel is very centrally located; hotel itself is beautifully furnished; staff is super friendly and helpful

The hotel is chic and is located in one of the best places you could stay in Paris. Close to everything important, but not too close that you have to run into crowd outside your hotel. The design is nice and is new (2022).

They promised gym and pool and it wasn‚Äôt ready. A discount could have been nice.

The location, the design, the excellent staff, the details

the last day I realized that there were also hot plates a la carte. no one told us about it and I never understood if they were included or not on the price.

Really friendly staff. Beautiful hotel, excellent location.

This hotel is perfection. The hotel itself and the rooms are simply beautiful and the staff are outstanding. The location is perfect. We will stay here every time without question. Exceeded our expectations - and we have high standards. Thanks for an absolutely perfect stay in Paris.

Great service,room finition, qualit√©

very clean, great towels and bath robes, comfortable bed

Both rooms we booked were stunning. Beautifully furnished throughout with private terrace and balconies. The staff were all lovely and well spoken in French and English. The bar staff were friendly and professional, making fantastic off menu cocktails. The location was perfect, near many attractions and caf√©s. Overall the hotel made our Paris visit a magical one. Thank you!

Class boutique type hotel where the staff couldn't do enough for you and this was a special occasion for my Wife's 50th birthday, they even had 50th balloons up for us arriving which my Daughter arranged through a female member of staff Claire Boura who she said was the most helpful person ever !!!
Nothing much to be honest as mentioned previously the English speaking channels, the Spa wasn't opened yet however they had arranged another Spa location as a surprise from our kids which is a different class service.

The location only
They charged me twice and they used my credit card before I arrived which was not the option I selected. Also, I couldn‚Äôt sleep as the Fire alarm waked me up early morning. The elevator location next to the kitchen and it‚Äôs smell bad and very noisy. The hotel experience was less than what I expected. I don‚Äôt recommend it at all. Aboce comments

Nothing
They put us in a room which they knew had a defect / mechanical issue. There was a terrible noise which impacted our sleep the first night. While they moved us the next night, it was too late and they acknowledged they knew of the problem. This room should never have been sold.

The concierge didn‚Äôt listen to instructions and messed up our dinner booking. He first booked too early then I asked him to change the time and alert the restaurant we would be late. We arrived at the restaurant who indicated they had not called them and that given it was full, there would be no table available. This was a Saturday night so didn‚Äôt have many other options ‚Ä¶

The lift entrance for the rooms was next to the restaurant service entrance. This is unacceptable. It was always full of service staff, who were not well trained even.
Y
I will certainly never go back.

The overall "vibe" of the place is charming. The lobby decor, lounge/library area was cozy. It was convenient to have the bar and restaurant right there. The nighttime concierge was extremely nice, helpful and engaging. Housekeeping did an AMAZING job. Our room was tidied nicely, and the bathroom was refreshed very well! The location of this hotel is PERFECT This was the best feature about this hotel.
The overall staff could be nicer (except for the concierge mentioned before). Our restaurant server wasn't very good--our section seemed secondary, and the place was not busy. Our room was tight and abuts the stairs. We constantly heard people using them. Good thing we were not in our room much.

Nice bar and restaurant area
Rooms were super tiny, the amenities not up to par for a 5 star rating. I was definitely disappointed.

AC was down for 2 nights. The hotel comped me one night when I asked.

hotel is beautiful and location wonderful. 
breakfast was really good. Lovely dining area.
Staff super helpful
Make sure you check your room as my room had the bathroom up a steep flight of stairs (really inconvenient) and cost Euro800/night....

The hotel itself was great, elegant and well presented. The pool and facilities were a great addition.
The Hotel is lovely but based on the overall stay, level of service and food, it is completely overpriced especially, as breakfast was not included. 
Dinner was lovely, but again overpriced. We were travelling with our 7yr old there was not much choice for her, we ate there for ease. The standard of the dinner did not reflect the price. The main dish was good, but the sides were poor Fries hard, veg no flavour.
I expected an efficient and excellent service when booking a hotel at the price bracket. This is part of the experience in my opinion. I expected smiley faces, whilst professional there was no personalities except for the gentleman at breakfast. 
Our cases we still not in our room at 6.30pm. 
Bar service was slow!

Great location in the heart of Saint Germain. The hotel exterior, lobby, restaurant, bar are all beautiful and the bed was comfortable. The room was also quiet which was nice.
The bathroom had a horrible mildew smell. The minute you walked into the room you could smell it. I could tell after a night of sleeping there is was making us sick. The city was packed with fashion week on the horizon and we couldn't find another hotel to move to. Very disappointing. Having to sleep in a mildew infested room ruined anything else that was nice about the hotel.

design ok

Le Melia Paris Champs Elys√©es vous accueille √† proximit√© des Champs-√âlys√©es et de la tour Eiffel. Vous pourrez ais√©ment rejoindre le quartier de La D√©fense et le palais des congr√®s de la Porte Maillot. Vous profiterez d'une connexion Internet gratuite dans l'ensemble de cet h√¥tel enti√®rement non-fumeurs.

Toutes les chambres du Melia Paris Champs Elys√©es disposent d'une salle de bains privative, de la climatisation et d'une bouilloire √©lectrique. Elles sont aussi dot√©es d'une ligne de t√©l√©phone directe et de la t√©l√©vision par satellite.

Le matin, vous pourrez savourer un petit-d√©jeuner buffet au restaurant ou dans votre chambre. De midi √† 22h30, un service d'√©tage est assur√© par un restaurant r√©put√© situ√© place Victor Hugo.

B√©n√©ficiant d'un emplacement id√©al pour visiter les sites d'int√©r√™t de la capitale, le Melia Paris Champs Elys√©es se trouve √† 2 minutes √† pied de la station de m√©tro Victor Hugo (sur la ligne 2) et du Trocad√©ro.

Room service was a disaster. 
When ever we ordered food each time they serviced it wrong. 
We ordered 2 coke zero, ice, 1 plain penne, 1 penne with sauce, water, soda.
They called us two times to check the order. Then what happened. 
They brought normal coke rather than zero, both pasta with sauce, no bottle opener to open the bottles. 
When we called room service for bottle opener they told us ‚Äúthey can‚Äôt leave bottle opener in the room because customers steal them. So first of all how rude attitude is this to us??? You call your customer as a potential thief. If you have such kind of a problem then charge the bottle opener from the deposit wich you take for the first night.
If we don‚Äôt have a bottle opener how are we going to drink the things in bottles???

Then room service came to room with opener and told us ‚Äúopen all of them at the same time‚Äù üòÇ so coke, water, perrier at the same time. If you don‚Äôt mind I want to decide on the timing of drinks I want to consume.

And also the other biggest problem ‚Äúroom service doesn‚Äôt speak enough level of English‚Äù come on how come? You are a 5 star hotel.

We ordered 2 earl grey tea and a big pot of hot water. They brought us two ‚Äúbig‚Äù pots with hot water, which is ok. But they already put the tea bags in the pots. ‚ÄúOne per each‚Äù. First biggest problem each pot has around 800-900 ml water, so each bag is for around 200ml water. 
So what is the logic behind this, tell me???

We drank a yellow hot water but it was not earl grey because it can‚Äôt be earl grey due to amount of water. 
I felt that we stayed in a 3th class, poor quality hostel. 

Jus to underline one thing; all of the staff had good manners and they were all respectful. No question about it. But this room service experience was the worst we have had so far. Hope you reassess your room service quality and very sensitive bottle opener approach for your future customers as we won‚Äôt be amongst them. There are 1.500 hotels in Paris.

Hotel is absolutely amazing. From the moment you arrive with the tentative front door guys to the check in process to the beautiful spacious yet cosy rooms. The bar and restaurant are fantastic and the breakfasts are to die for.
I would really recommend the Sunday brunch too.... Wow! Big shout out to Julian for being do fantastic at breakfast and brunch. Will definitely stay again.
I loved everything!

everything!

loved the decor of the hotel

Great hotel, amazing gym, food was the best we had in Paris. Staff couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful.

the service + the decor

the rooms are decorated in simply stunning style, and the beds are Uber comfortable‚Ä¶ each room is unique and the service is very peeps alized, with gifts for the kids and cool flip flops for the pool. the pool area is great with a huge jacuzzi but used by the gym for classes so gets a little crowded‚Ä¶ also it‚Äôs right by the gym so doesn‚Äôt feel so cosy or private‚Ä¶ as the gym is used by outsiders I believe‚Ä¶ 
the music channels in the rooms is a beautiful touch and the bathrooms are gorgeous and very comfortable.
it is still overpriced though, even though it‚Äôs beautiful and well managed. the rooms are on the small side even for paris, and there isn‚Äôt much added service offered.

Exquisite hotel - beautifully designed, buzzing and with a distinct character. The neighborhood (16th arrondissement) is very nice - quiet and residential yet chic, with most key attractions within a reasonable 15-20 min taxi ride. Great toiletries, minibar, room amenities.

The Evok Conciergerie team is absolutely fantastic - extremely responsive and helped me arrange a smooth and enjoyable itinerary - did not have to worry about a single reservation as all the restaurants I wanted to visit had been booked well in advance per my request, and all requests to reschedule/rearrange were addressed in a prompt and friendly manner. Hotel staff were wonderful and helpful too!
The rooms are rather small (even the Superior category) - probably par for the course for Paris, so not really a downside - more of an aspect to be aware of (was pretty tricky to open up a large suitcase in the room‚Ä¶). Also was a bit difficult to figure out the various switches for the lighting in the room.

Breakfast options in the hotel restaurant are nice, but can be quite pricey (especially when opting for √† la carte) - would be nice to have breakfast included at this price point for the rooms.

Beautiful design, amazing service. The whole staff was very helpful!

the decoration. the food. the beds.
I didn‚Äôt like that it smelled of food throughout the building. The lobby/restaurant felt really busy all the time with people not staying at the hotel.

Yes, it can be fairly expensive but it's a beautifully furnished hotel with exceptionally large, clean and incredibly comfortable rooms. Really liked the nice touches of hand written notes and chocolates.

I‚Äôd say the only thing I see could be improved are the cocktails quality at the 1st and 6th floor. it‚Äôs just ok but nothing creative and quality of ingredients could be better. attitude of staff is great though. special thanks to the restaurant manager lady at 1st floor. very hard working and efficient chefs too ! yummy food there. bravo!

L'√©tablissement La Clef Louvre Paris by The Crest Collection est situ√© dans le centre-ville de Paris, en face de la Com√©die-Fran√ßaise, √† 500 m√®tres du mus√©e du Louvre et du Jardin des Tuileries. Il propose des suites modernes climatis√©es avec kitchenette enti√®rement √©quip√©e.

L'√©tablissement La Clef Louvre Paris by The Crest Collection poss√®de une salle de sport ainsi qu'une r√©ception ouverte 24h/24 assurant des services de blanchisserie et de nettoyage √† sec. Vous pourrez vous d√©tendre dans le salon √©quip√© d'une t√©l√©vision √† √©cran LCD, d'un ordinateur avec imprimante et d'une connexion Internet gratuite.

La Clef Louvre Paris by The Crest Collection se trouve √† 100 m√®tres de la rue Saint-Honor√© et √† 800 m√®tres de l'Op√©ra. La station de m√©tro Palais Royal - Mus√©e du Louvre, permettant un acc√®s direct √† la Bastille et La D√©fense, se situe √† 140 m√®tres.

Le Nolinski Paris - Evok Collection est situ√© dans le 1er arrondissement de Paris, √† 500 m√®tres du jardin des Tuileries et √† proximit√© du quartier commer√ßant de la rue du Faubourg Saint-Honor√©. Cet h√¥tel 5 √©toiles parisien propose un spa avec une piscine, un sauna, un hammam et des salles de massage. et o√π vous pourrez appr√©cier des produits de beaut√© La Colline.

Spacieuses et lumineuses, les chambres et suites de l‚Äôh√¥tel sont dot√©es de rideaux somptueux, de tapis moelleux, d‚Äôune literie de qualit√©, de grandes armoires et d‚Äôun bureau √©l√©gant. Des peignoirs et des chaussons sont fournis pour davantage de confort. Certaines chambres poss√®dent des fen√™tres et un balcon donnant sur le c≈ìur de Paris.

Comfortable and very trendy boutique hotel moments away from museum and main shopping district. Dinner service is a must at the hotel restaurant!

Lovely unique rooms in a perfect location near the Louvre.
It was Paris fashion week when we stayed that led to rowdy guests in other rooms. Music travelled easily into our room.

loved the location, the interior and look of the hotel. amazing works of art everywhere and the scent in the hotel sets you for a nice all senses luxury experience. loved how luxurious everything was. loved the comfort of the room, nice and spacious, could turn off the aircon because it was warm enough, loved that I could open the window to the little balcony and look at the view outside overlooking Opera, staff were wonderful and helpful. got 1.5 hr late check out.
the food. the pot coffee was not good, my eggs came cold, salad was not fresh, however they took them off my bill. so still managed to make me happy.

stylish. centrally located. beautiful.

The Nolinski is one of the most outstanding hotels we have ever been, and it definetly wasn't the first "better hotel" we have visited. Every single aspect was just amazing. We had high expectations based on the price and they managed to exceed it. The room: Superb, with an amazingly comfy bed and a small balcony with a view to the opera. The hotel is between the opera and the louvre, and while I did not even realize that when booking, it was amazing. On the question where we could east out "well" close by the answer was "everywhere around" and damn that was correct. In the same street you will find one of the best sweet bakeries in the world, around the corner the pyramides bistro is the perfect location for a quick soupe l'oignon and the metro pyramides is literally right in front of the hotel. While the space in the spa is tiny and more meant for a "i go to the spa, and then to the room" situation, swimming in the mirror ceiled pool after a short warming up in the sauna was just the best thing in the moment ever - after a cold and rainy day in januaryr. The cocktails in the bar were amazing and when we on the last evening only had 30 minutes before we needed to leave the bar keeper had not yet opened the bar - he still tried his best to serve the best sazerac and old fashioned we have drunk in quite some time, and that is our basic cocktail.

All in all, this was a special trip for us and the Nolinski staff made it to the best they could. I could not have asked for a single thing more. Thank you for going the extra mile on every single request we had, including the amazing service at our lunch and while we did not catch the name of the staff at the breakfast: Thank you, you made every single start of the day as good as it could have been,

This was one of the best trips we ever had and you were part of making it that great!
Let's face it, there are really only two things you could not like, one is the tiny rest space in the spa and the second is the price. For us and this was a special trip we could not have asked for more, but your mileage might vary.

Another person brought in the right order. Very rude and unprofessional. Also, once with housekeeping. They wanted to clean the room and I told them to come back in an hour or so. When they did and I wasn't ready, she sounded irritated. I think they should recognize that guests are on vacation and need not be held to a strict timeline. Didn't expect such response from a five star hotel.

very nice Art Deco styled hotel, 5 star customer service as expected, the location is almost perfect 10 mins from rue de faubourg for shopping lovers. very clean rooms.

I booked my stay for a programmed surgical procedure nearby and my stay was comfortably 10/10
the floors in the bathroom have carpets installed, which is not very hygienic as a concept although to be honest I didn‚Äôt see a single mark or traces, but it smelled funny sometimes. that‚Äôs the only negative point I‚Äôd think of, I hope that they may reconsider the flooring.

location, friendly staff , very clean room

The staff excellent, friendly and helpful. The rooms were great quality and cleaning superb.
No coffee or tea in room which was strange for a five star hotel. Little toiletries in room and didn‚Äôt bring toothpaste when asked. The spa customer service was not good compared to hotel reception. Asked for time of a treatment but never got back to us.

On final morning booked a car to station that didn‚Äôt turn up and hotel staff didn‚Äôt do anything until I chased them so was 15 minutes late and had to get my own taxi in the street which was poor service for such a five star hotel.

They are dont have tea maker ,and coffe mashin
No have dental pak dont have shower cap

The facilities and the location
The AC was off for two nights, however after a discussion they compensated me with 50%.
Also I the deposit was taken as a purchase not an on hold transaction, when I checked out the calculation was incorrect and emailed them to amend but until now I didn‚Äôt receive the balance as a release back to my account or a transfer!!!

I think the breakfast not new, should be prepared every day.
In my opinion clearance is very important in anywhere.

Wonderful location and fabulous premise and staff.
My room had a shower that would drain properly and the hot water would turn luke warm for two of the four days I was there. The shower issues were resolved the last night I was there.

Beautiful
Price, service. The stay was prepaid, but upon arrival the hotel asked for 1200 ‚Ç¨ as deposit. We stayed there for 3 nights in 2 rooms. We were surprised by the amount and asked about it, they said they charge 200 ‚Ç¨ deposit / night / room. After paying 4000 ‚Ç¨ for the stay, asking for additional 1200 is excessive. But we paid it. What made us upset after that was to find our rooms not cleaned at 5 pm. We left the hotel at 9 am, returned at 5 pm and the cleaning staff was by our door. We had to get ready for an event, so we couldn't wait for them to clean. Which is not the end of the world but after paying so much money, paying the deposit, it was disappointing. Even in 4star hotels they magage to clean our rooms in time.

Very nice reception staff, very clean, beautiful design. Great position.
Very expensive, room with (slight) sloping roof, 6th floor, one lift broken, Japanese electric bidet loo seat broken. Restaurant lacking in atmosphere and massively over-priced.

The property has a nice location
I have stayed in many 5 star hotels but think it was very expensive and not worth the money. I didn‚Äôt like the carpet-like flooring in the bathroom- yuck- and the hotel was very dark. I asked for a quiet room but as I was on the 1st floor, could hear the metro underneath. Also, the pool temperature was too cold and the restaurant was just ok. Breakfast wasn‚Äôt included in my rate and the one morning we ate there, my poached eggs arrived freezing cold. I sent them back but received no reduction in the cost of my breakfast. Also, the hotel does not have any outdoor space and it‚Äôs concierge service was outsourced to a third party and not helpful. I would not stay here again for almost $900 per night- excluding breakfast!

Great location, nice interior. Nice staff at reception.
High price for a 4-Star hotel (it is not 5-Star to my point of view). Plus and more importantly: Unfortunately, I left personal belongings in one drawer in the room (two black belts I really loved and I wore in Paris). Was told, that they haven‚Äôt found anything. My Montblanc writing pen (I always have in my business bag for many, many years) is missing since then as well. I don‚Äôt seem to be the first one who had this experience at Nolinski (see other reviews).

Location
The bidet washer in our room wasn‚Äôt working and we asked more than 3 times to fix it but nothing happened sadly .. plus the AC wasn‚Äôt working properly.

Room clean, modern, high spec. Location excellent.
Didn't feel like very good value.

lots of smell from the drains

the location was very good, and the rooms
The restaurant had a party on Saturday and the music was so loud I could hear it all night in my room so did not sleep well Saturday night. My parents had the exact same thing.

Nice Hotel, Good location
sleeping on floor 2, we could not sleep from the music from the restaurant, and all this for 900 euro? Also breakfast service was below level and the choice were limited and overpriced.

Beautiful, well designed rooms. Room service food was delicoous although the menu limited.

nicely maintained
location and no concierge

Not 5 star ! 4 at best

full_description:
Overlooking Paris's oldest planned square, the Place des Vosges, the Cour des Vosges - Evok Collection offers upscale accommodation in the Marais district, 450 metres from Place de la Bastille. The hotel boasts facilities such as a Roman Bath, in-room massages and a personal trainer.

Each room at the Cour des Vosges - Evok Collection has a private bathroom complete with bathrobes, slippers and toiletries. There is also a flat-screen TV, a streaming service and a minibar. Some rooms feature a kitchenette.

An √† la carte breakfast is served each morning at the Cour des Vosges - Evok Collection, and guests can also enjoy breakfast from the comfort of their room. Guests can dine in the hotel's restaurant and there is a 24-hour front desk.

Pompidou Centre is 1.7 km from the hotel, while Sainte-Chapelle is 1.8 km from the property. The nearest airport is Paris - Orly Airport, 16 km from Cour des Vosges - Evok Collection.

The location of the property is perfect. Nestled away on the edge of Place de Voges, it is a beautiful and quiet haven nestled in the centre of the city. A short stroll to the Bastille, Seine and Notre Dame. 

From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome by the staff. They were attentive, friendly and not over bearing - the size and nature of the hotel gives the service a very professional yet personal touch. 

This trip is was a treat for us but there is no doubt that our experience will mean that when we are next back in Paris we will stay at Cour des Voges

full_description:
This design hotel is situated in the centre of Paris, just a 10-minute walk from the Louvre. Guests can relax in the indoor swimming pool with natural daylight, or visit the sauna with a steam room and multi-jet shower. A well-equipped fitness room is also available to guests.

The air-conditioned rooms and suites at Renaissance Paris Vendome feature a flat-screen TV, safe. Each room has a marble bathroom with bathrobes, slippers and Tokyo Milk complimentary wellness products.

The Renaissance Paris Vendome Hotel regularly organises temporary art exhibitions and concerts in the lobby to introduce you to the neighborhood.

The hotel is 110 metres from the Jardin de Tuileries and its iconic Ferris Wheel. Tuileries Metro Station is just 180 metres from the hotel, providing direct access to the Champs-Elys√©es.

L'H√¥tel De Sers vous accueille dans un manoir du XIXe si√®cle, situ√© √† seulement 400 m√®tres de l'avenue des Champs-√âlys√©es. Il vous propose une cour, une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite, un sauna ainsi qu'un hammam.

Climatis√©es et insonoris√©es, toutes les chambres disposent d'une t√©l√©vision √† √©cran plat et d'un lecteur DVD/CD. Chacune d'elles comprend √©galement des √©quipements de qualit√© tels qu'une salle de bains en marbre ou du mobilier en bois de rose. La plupart des suites offrent une vue superbe sur la capitale.

Le restaurant de l'h√¥tel se situe au bout de la galerie de portraits de l'h√¥tel et donne sur une cour arbor√©e. Vous pourrez d√Æner dans sa salle √† manger pourvue d'un d√©cor en marbre ou sur la terrasse en √©t√©. Par√© de boiseries et d'un comptoir en marbre, le S'Ba sert un grand choix de cocktails.

L'H√¥tel De Sers se trouve √† 5 minutes √† pied des stations de m√©tro George V et Alma - Marceau, qui vous permettront de rejoindre tous les sites c√©l√®bres de Paris. Sur r√©servation pr√©alable, des massages et des transferts a√©roport peuvent √™tre organis√©s.

D√®s la confirmation t√©l√©phonique, l'√©quipe a su faire preuve d'un professionnalisme irr√©prochable. √Ä mon arriv√©e, l'accueil a √©t√© chaleureux et attentionn√©, une vraie bouff√©e de fra√Æcheur. Le service voiturier est √©galement un vrai plus, particuli√®rement √† Paris.

L'h√¥tel lui-m√™me est un bijou : il allie charme, modernit√© et propret√© exemplaire. Les chambres, spacieuses par rapport aux standards parisiens, offrent un confort optimal. All the staff were fantastic! Special mention for Naomi and Cedric and doorman Alexandrie. Everyone was so helpful and the extra amenities offered for the birthday surprise was above and beyond. Fantastic stay!

Worst breakfast in all of the Europe hotels we stayed. Expensive and minimalistic. Not even in a 3 star hotel did we ever experience such poor breakfast
Everything needs to be upgraded in order to call this hotel 5 star

location, cleanliness, staff was amazing

the location was wonderful, the staff was friendly and the hotel itself is beautiful!!

We booked a suite and we got smaller than a normal room space. The fool you with a terrace space that you don't use but the actual room is TOO small, toilet is awful. A total rip off and no one cared nor asked.

The manager sends her typical copy paste emails before you arrive and you would think the customer service will be great at the hotel.
How they fool their customer and they don't care.

WE have been staying at this hotel for the last 5 years but never had such an experience before.

The location is amazing, the lobby is cute. The staff was very helpful.
My shower was leaking water from the side of the fixture. This is not a 5 star hotel. They turn the air conditioning off at night. It was really hot during sleeping.

they charge my credit card in advance before arrival than when we arrived to the hotel they asked us money again? it‚Äôs take them awhile to understand even I show them the receipt with email confirmation from the hotel that we paid but still they took time & I have different charges with different amount in the card?

the cost

nice location but it‚Äôs not a 5 star hotel. reminds me of a budget ibis hotel next to the airport. no facilities or amenities what so ever.
very small rooms, unfriendly staff, incompetent receptionist. spa treatment was a joke - some random lady gives you a massage in one of the rooms..

The location is nice and the staff are helpful and friendly
Paid more then 600 euros. Room not as in the photos. I found a dirty damp towel on the shower floor. I could not sleep because of the dripping sound coming from the broken shower head. Turns out the towel was left there on purpose. It was a known fault in the room and I think it is unacceptable that they did not attempt to fix it amd decided to sell the room anyway. Silly to have such low standard of care to not rectify such an important aspect of a guests well being.

Perfect location, the staff were amazing and very helpful and extremely kind.

The beds were comfortable. They had a Shattaf (water hose) at the toilet which was a big plus for us. The balcony was tiny and not as per what is shown on the webpage. The wifi was good, the staff was extremely friendly. The location is great.
This is not a 5-star hotel. The cleaning was disappointing, the cleaning lady was barraged one time when my wife and I were still in the room, she didn't give a second for me to answer the door, I found this rude. She did not speak any English. They need to sort out the breakfast option with booking.com, I do not want to get involved with booking.com and the hotel's agreement. The cleaning crew did not clean the room properly, nor the bathroom, and also have not restocked the room's drinks and water.
Water that was supposed to be provided for us was charged on my bill, it seems that the staff was not trained to handle a 5 star, I would expect a better organization when it comes to how much I paid. The telephone in the room did not work. The door handle on the balcony keeps coming off. 
If you want a more consistent service, try the four seasons next door.

Breakfast was delicious - fresh orange or grapefruit juice, mouth watering viennoiserie, scrambled eggs, fresh fruit and yoghurt. 
I wanted a coffee maker in my room and they accommodated my request.
A coffee maker in each room.

Hotel is Good, with basic facilities. Location is very convenient, at 5 min walk from Champs √âlys√©es

Friendly staff and good location.
The price is too high compared to the room quality and size.

Das Personal war wirklich sehr zuvorkommend, nett und hat immer versucht f√ºr Probleme L√∂sungen zu finden. Vor allem der Herr welcher sich um das Parken und An- und Abreise der G√§ste k√ºmmert war wunderbar!
Wir hatten extra mehr bezahlt um ein gr√∂√üeres Zimmer mit Balkon und Badewanne zu bekommen. Das Zimmer war nie im Leben 30 m2 gro√ü, der Balkon war 1m breit und 30 cm tief und man schaute auf einen richtig h√§√ülichen und ungepflegten Innenhof. Auf dem Balkon noch Zigarettenstummel vom Vor- Vor- Vormieter. Bei allen Fenstern welche man √∂ffnen konnte fand man Spinnweben und wirklich viel Dreck. Der TV war leider defekt und einen Techniker kommen zu lassen w√§hrend unser kleiner Sohn im Kinderbett schlief, kam auch aufgrund des kleinen Zimmers f√ºr uns leider nicht in Frage. Das "Spa" wenn man es so nennen kann bestand aus einer Saune 2,5m2 und einem Fitnessraum. Man hatte nicht mal eine Liege zum entspannen. Wirklich Schade, da man den Aufpreis von ich glaube 120 ‚Ç¨ wirklich absolut nicht wahrnehmen konnte. Dann lieber ohne Balkon, gleiches Zimmer zum g√ºnstigeren Preis.

full_description:
Le Grand Powers est situ√© dans le triangle d'or √† Paris, dans le 8√®me arrondissement. Cet h√¥tel de charme 5 √©toiles compte un spa avec hammam, sauna et jacuzzi.

Certaines chambres et suites sont d√©cor√©es avec du parquet et une chemin√©e, tandis que plusieurs poss√®dent un balcon offrant une vue sur la tour Eiffel. Chaque h√©bergement dispose d'une t√©l√©vision connect√©e et d'une machine √† caf√© Nespresso. Leur salle de bains est pourvue d'articles de toilette Dyptique.

L'√©tablissement vous servira un petit-d√©jeuner buffet am√©ricain chaque matin. Vous pourrez prendre vos repas ou un verre au bar-restaurant Caf√© 52.

Le personnel de la conciergerie Clefs d'Or se fera un plaisir de vous fournir des informations sur les environs.

Les Champs-√âlys√©es sont √† 250 m√®tres du Grand Powers, tandis que l'avenue Montaigne se situe √† 350 m√®tres. Enfin, vous rejoindrez l'a√©roport de Paris-Orly √† 18 km.

I recently stayed at this hotel with our family, and it was a wonderful experience. The hotel is in an excellent location, making it easy to travel to and from the main tourist destinations.

The rooms were comfortable, clean, and well-maintained, offering a relaxing environment after a long day of sightseeing. What truly stood out, though, was the exceptional service from the staff.

A special shoutout to Mathilde, who went above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed. Her support and accommodating attitude made our stay even more enjoyable. It's rare to come across such attentive and thoughtful service, and Mathilde deserves all the praise.

We highly recommend this Novotel to families and travelers looking for a combination of comfort, convenience, and excellent service. We'll definitely be returning!
The surrounding areas have limited food options.

Excellent value, kind and helpful staff. Practical breakfast (the sausages were not to my taste though!) that was just right for my family. Good sized room. Metro right out the door, which makes it a lot easier at the end of a tiring day.
They did not have the integrated bathroom despite the request, so we had a separated toilet without a sink. 
It is a busy season after all, so not a problem.
A little issue with the cleanliness with the room initially but the staff were professional and handled it well, which we really appreciated.

The hotel is beautifully designed and quiet! The staff were very professional and accommodating, especially Francesco, who gave me a quick tour (for my business). We were traveling with my mother in a wheelchair and he was so helpful and kind as was everyone we interacted with at the hotel. We will definitely stay here again and I will definitely recommend it.

Location, room and amenities, personnel.
Nothing.

Room, bed, design are great.

If you are looking for a small, quaint, high quailty city hotel, this is a great choice in my opinion. The suite we stayed in was decorated to a really high standard, Good size bathroom, bar area in the corridor, great size living room and the main bedroom was also a great size overlooking the courtyard and a walk in closet with ample space. I stayed with a family of 4 and was sufficient in size. Parking at the rear of the hotel with ease. Staff were pleasant and were available whenever we needed. We didn't use the gym or spa so cannot comment. The breakfast was good with the usual choice. We basically had the dining area to ourselves, which was lovely and personal which pretty much sums up this hotel. The Hotel had pretty much all things you would normally expect if you wanted. The location was amazing. Pretty much a stones throw from the Pl. de la Concorde so we could walk pretty much everywhere we wanted to go. Plenty of good quality restaurants nearby.
Hard to be critical as we didn't experience anything which I didn't like. I wasn't disappointed and had a lovely experience. Thank you!

This boutique hotel is so cute. Our bed was very comfortable, and the location is the best.

Fabulous location and great room layout for families!

Everything

Good, helpful and attentive service. Good breakfast in a lovely appointed room.Rooms were also beautifully decorated and comfortable. attention to detail with three layers of curtains which created a total blackout and also kept the room warm from draughts.
For a Relais and Chateau Hotel, we expect there to be a proper pint of fresh milk in the fridge for coffee and tea. instead we were given measly little mass produced little tiny pots which you get at a 2 star hotel. Also we were only given 2 bottles of water when we checked in and these were never replenished on a daily basis. Again something I would never expect in a R and C hotel of this calibre (and room rate) Lastly the bathroom was cold because the towel rail does not work even though there was a switch. There doesn't seem to be any attempt to rectify this problem and the management just seem to accept it and hope that the guests just live with it.

Amazing layout

The location was great - close to many great sites in Paris. The staff were friendly and accommodating.
Access with a car was challenging because of construction in the opposite building. This should be temporary though.

Design and location
Noisy laundry people at 2am

This is a perfectly located hotel in Paris. The rooms are well appointed and the master suite where we stayed is ideal for our family of two adults and two children as it has two separate rooms. The size of the rooms, the storage space, the furniture - everything is 5 star.
The hotel is too small, too boutique. The breakfast room is very cozy but the selection is very small. The room service is non-existent. The gym is very small.

location
too small. more of a motel

This was our fourth and most likely our last stay here. They did not even as much as say welcome back but asked us if this was our first time staying there upon arrival. We had several issues this time, but most importantly the concierge told us he would make a reservation at a restaurant at a specific time and when we got to the place there was no reservation (apparently he forgot to tell us they did not have availability). The credit card machine at check-in did not connect to their usually spotty wifi and we had to wait, rather than them letting us relax in our room after a 24 hr. journey and deal with it later. This was super annoying. One time we needed ice and the hotel had run out of it. Another time we were expecting a large parcel and the front desk had no knowledge of it, but it turns out it was already in the room. They were going to send us a bottle of wine as an apology, but that bottle never made it. ......
Make sure that the very small entrance area is ventilated as it always has a smell of BO.

Hotel itself is like a small club hotel, old building but very nicely renovated. My room was specious and nice interior. Clean, nice smelling. I did not checked anything about room service, but they do not have a restaurant. There is a restaurant next door, but booking must be done in advance.

nothing
When we arrived as a family and on a road trip carrying many bags, there was no one in the hotel to carry the bags. When I asked them, the answer was that we do not have a porter and you have to curry them your self. I had to carry the bags into the room. When I got to the room, it wasn't the room they told me about. As after I booked the room on Booking website, I called the hotel and asked them about the room and requested a connecting room, and they assured me that they could provide it, so I told them that I would ask for it upon my arrival as we are a family and we will need an extra room. Their answer was we dont have connected rooms and this is what is what we have.i said ok fine. I called to order room service and their answer was that they don't have room service!! Is it possible for a five star hotel dont have baggage service and no room service, and no resturant except a very poor place for breakfast.
 I asked them to cancel my reservation and i will find another place to stay, they told me You cant because your reservation is through Booking.com. We don't mind if Booking agrees.
 I called Booking's customer service and they were very helpful and they agreed to cancel as the hotel was OK. I went back to the reception and told him, he said no, I will not cancel the reservation!!! Its paid for you can go but we will not refund. Ok why you put me through all this if you are not going to cancel?
The next day, my wife went shopping and bought clothes from a well-known brand store, and the store sent them to the hotel. When we returned, we asked about the bags. The reception said we did not receive anything, ask the store. We called the store, and he assured us that he had delivered it to the hotel front disk.We went back to the reception and he said go to the shop, we went to the shop, so the seller called the hotel and the receptionist told him we have the bag!!! We went back to the hotel and they told us we had nothing!!!!

L‚ÄôHotel Lutetia est un √©tablissement de luxe embl√©matique situ√© dans le quartier de Saint-Germain-des-Pr√©s. Implant√© sur la rive gauche de la Seine, il se trouve √† 5 minutes √† pied du grand magasin Le Bon March√© et √† 2 km du Mus√©e du Louvre.

V√©ritable lieu d‚Äôint√©r√™t parisien, l‚Äôh√¥tel propose 184 chambres, dont 40 suites et 7 suites signature. Tous les h√©bergements disposent d'une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite, de syst√®mes multim√©dia et de salles de bains en marbre. Certaines chambres comprennent un balcon donnant sur la tour Eiffel, tandis que certaines suites sont pourvues d‚Äôun toit-terrasse jouissant d‚Äôune vue √† 360 degr√©s sur Paris.

Apr√®s une journ√©e bien remplie, vous pourrez vous d√©tendre au spa Akasha dot√© d‚Äôune salle de sport, d‚Äôun sauna, d‚Äôun hammam et d‚Äôune piscine int√©rieure de 17 m√®tres de long profitant d‚Äôun √©clairage naturel. Par ailleurs, une large gamme de soins de spa est dispens√©e moyennant des frais suppl√©mentaires.

Plusieurs types de petits-d√©jeuners vous seront propos√©s chaque matin, y compris des formules sans gluten, halal, kasher et v√©g√©tariennes. Pour le d√©jeuner et le d√Æner, vous pourrez vous rendre √† la c√©l√®bre brasserie Lutetia ou au restaurant Saint-Germain. L‚Äôh√¥tel dispose aussi d‚Äôun √©l√©gant salon √† cigares et d‚Äôun bar de jazz con√ßu par Jean Michel Willmotte.

The Lutetia is a wonderful experience : very classy, nice interior, perfect service, without being exaggerated. The rooms are pretty spacious for Paris standards, and so is the hotel gym. Perfectly located in one of the best neighbourhoods of Paris, the hotel is very well connected with public transport (metro right across the street).
Breakfast is nice with truly high quality foods, but the size of the buffet appears to be somewhat limited. While the rooms are well insulated against street noise, the air conditioning / ventilation inside the room is pretty noisy. Overall, room rates are undeniably high, so there is clearly a question mark as to the total value for money you get. I would nevertheless come back one more time.

1) Perfect location: surrounded by beautiful bakeries, authentic Parisian lifestyle, non-touristic yet luxury, cool and under-the-radar, only luxury five star grand hotel on the left bank 
2) Interior Design and Suites: Unique design of each specialty suite respectively dedicated to one artist or one theme. I experienced the Coppola Penthouse Suite. the balance of authentic mid-century chic, lofty Parisian attic perfected by the luxury furniture, the intricate eye for detail, the collaboration with Francis Coppola for the special final touches: his authentic vintage cameras around the living room, art pieces donated by Coppola on every wall. Shelves of books filled with art, cinema, literature, photography, culture and city guides, literatary, etc., that will make you want to sit and read each one (1 year may be enough for that). The bathroom and bedroom don‚Äôt leave a single thing more you could want. A marble bathtub with a view and a bedroom with a long size cloud mattress, TV adjustable to any angle, and a terrace opposite the bed. 
3) Rooftop and View: The three balconies all have the post-card Eiffel Tower view, but the stairs, covered by a glass top that can be opened or closed using a single button, open it and step up to a rooftop, wrapping around almost the whole top floor of the building, with sun beds and a view tang is possibly the best in the city. 
Customer Service: Every single member of staff was kinder than necessary, and genuine in their care and smiles. The English is perfect, 24/7 room service, a spa with a large indoor pool, and a concierge ready to meet all your requests.

Nothing. All was great

To celebrate our 27th wedding anniversary, my husband and I chose this hotel at which we had stayed for our Paris honeymoon trip in 1995. The recently renovated property, which earned the designation of Palace Hotel in 2018, is stunningly beautiful. Our experience was exceptional, from the gracious welcome and tour we received upon arrival, to the luxurious comforts of our room (such as silky-smooth bed linens and four of the loftiest and plumpest down pillows I have ever seen, blackout curtains that drew closed at the tap of a finger on the screen on the wall, and an all-marble bathroom and shower with a rain shower-head in the ceiling), to the bespoke housekeeping and service (such as coming back to our room to find our slippers laid out on cotton mats on each side of the bed and our luggage and toiletries placed on similar cotton mats so that they did not contact the marble shelves or the wood parquet floor, and on our wedding anniversary coming back to our room to find a gorgeous, gilded red-rose cake for us to enjoy). Every morning we enjoyed the American Breakfast buffet in the Brasserie Lutetia, and it was a delicious extravagance of treats and delicacies. The croissants are perfection! And the kitchen makes (to order) French crepes and American pancakes with equal aplomb. Please see my attached photos, which say it all. I give the Hotel Lutetia my highest recommendation: it exceeded all our expectations, and we look forward to coming back.

Ic√¥ne de l'√©l√©gance et de l'art de vivre √† la fran√ßaise, Le Bristol Paris - an Oetker Collection Hotel est situ√© √† l'une des adresses les plus prestigieuses de la ville, rue du Faubourg Saint-Honor√©. Premier des 31 h√¥tels fran√ßais √† recevoir la distinction ¬´ Palais ¬ª, l'h√¥tel se trouve √† quelques pas d'une poign√©e d'autres palais embl√©matiques, notamment l'√âlys√©e, le Grand Palais et le Louvre.
Enti√®rement r√©nov√©es, les 190 chambres et suites (parmi les plus grandes de Paris) ont conserv√© toute leur sophistication classique avec un mobilier des √©poques Louis XV et Louis XVI et des ≈ìuvres d'art originales, le tout compl√©t√© par une palette lumineuse et contemporaine de teintes douces, de boiseries somptueuses et d‚Äôint√©rieurs nobles. Les vues propos√©es d'un c√¥t√© balaient les toits de Paris jusqu'√† la Tour Eiffel et Montmartre. De l'autre, un jardin luxuriant de 1 200 m¬≤ offre une oasis de verdure et de calme.

Le Bristol est peut-√™tre plus connu pour son exceptionnelle tradition gastronomique que l'h√¥tel perp√©tue depuis plus de 20 ans. √âpicure, le restaurant phare du Bristol pour son menu d√©gustation et sa carte des vins prim√©e,d√©tient 3 √©toiles Michelin depuis 2009. Le 114 Faubourg, un restaurant classique de style brasserie, conserve son √©toile Michelin depuis 2013.
Les 2 restaurants offrent un rare t√™te-√†-t√™te avec des ingr√©dients r√©gionaux transform√©s en de d√©licieux plats pr√©par√©s par des experts. Vous pourrez les d√©guster avec du pain aux c√©r√©ales anciennes fait maison, du moulin √† l‚Äôassiette en passant par le four.

Du matin au soir, il √©mane de l‚Äôh√¥tel une joie de vivre contagieuse. Le Caf√© Antonia offre un refuge paisible, id√©al pour d√©guster un repas l√©ger ou un go√ªter pr√©par√© par le chef p√¢tissier, dans le bar du hall ou (si la saison le permet) dans le spectaculaire jardin de la cour. Quand la nuit tombe, Le Bar du Bristol s‚Äô√©veille sous l‚Äô√©clairage tamis√© des n√©ons violets, pour une soir√©e B.A.D (Bristol After Dark) typiquement parisienne. L'extraordinaire piscine sur le toit et la terrasse bien expos√©e, la salle de sport enti√®rement √©quip√©e, le hammam et le spa prim√© Le Bristol by La Prairie offrent de luxueuses possibilit√©s de bien-√™tre pour contrebalancer les plaisirs h√©donistes. Sans oublier que les plus jeunes pourront profiter de soins spa con√ßus exclusivement pour les enfants en collaboration avec Bonpoint.

Une v√©ritable √©l√©gance parisienne depuis 1925.

Situ√© au c≈ìur de Paris, √† seulement 600 m√®tres de l'op√©ra Garnier et des grands magasins Galeries Lafayette, le Mercure Paris Opera Louvre propose des chambres climatis√©es et √©l√©gantes ainsi qu'une connexion Wi-Fi gratuite.

Desservies par un ascenseur, toutes disposent d'une t√©l√©vision par satellite √† √©cran plat, d'un plateau/bouilloire et d'une salle de bains privative.

Un petit-d√©jeuner buffet vous sera servi dans la salle √† manger du XVIIIe si√®cle. Vous pourrez d√©guster une s√©lection de collations et de boissons dans le confort de votre chambre en faisant appel au service d'√©tage, disponible de midi √† minuit.

Le Mercure Paris Opera Louvre se trouve √† quelques pas du mus√©e du Louvre et du jardin des Tuileries. La station de m√©tro Richelieu-Drouot est √† 150 m√®tres de l'h√¥tel, tandis que la place de la Concorde est accessible en 22 minutes √† pied.

The building and inside is quaint typical parisian style. Quite narrow in places, but can get around without problems. The lift is a bit slow though. The location is good and the breakfast room (and the breakfasts - both wonderful!) The hotel has potential to be excellent - most of the staff hard working and tried very hard. The building itself has issue - we suspect a shoddy renovation was done so some rooms had problems with air conditioning (ours was fine thankfully) but our room had a bathroom sink that flooded so unable to use. The hotel was full that night so the night manager promised us another and better room for the next night. The next morning the woman at the desk acted like she knew nothing about it (this woman should not be in the hospitality industry!) and we had to strongly advocate for a new room. We did - eventually - get a new and nicer room - however the hotel had a problem with towels and we were given one towel! Also - found out that the hair dryer could not be plugged in to the bathroom to dry and style my hair! Electrical issues with the plug. 
All this for a lot of money!! Value for money it was not.

A quaint (in a good way) little hotel in downtown Paris - really little, since they only have 21 rooms in total. The staff was helpful and friendly, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the breakfast was excellent. The local neighbourhood has plenty of cafes and bistros, so no need to go hungry or thirsty, and many of the sights in the centre of Paris (the Opera, Galeries Lafayette, Jardin des Tuileries, the Louvre, etc.) are within easy walking distance.
Well, if I had to mention something, it's the fact that (in my room, at least), the toilet and the sink/bath were in separate rooms - something I'm not used to, and which therefore seemed a bit inconvenient.
